title: Block of Bamboo
summary:
The block of bamboo is a block made of bamboo.
A block of stripped bamboo is an alternate variant made by using an axe on a block of bamboo.

title: Bamboo Mosaic
summary: A bamboo mosaic is a decorative block crafted out of bamboo slabs.

title: Camel
summary: The camel is a passive mob found in desert villages that can be ridden by two players in the same time using a saddle.

title: Chiseled Bookshelf
summary: Chiseled bookshelves are blocks that can hold books, books and quills, written books, and enchanted books.

title: Bossbar
summary: A boss bar is a bar that can track a boss mob's health.

title: Fire patch
summary: A fire patch is a feature that consists of fire or soul fire.

title: Glow lichen (feature)
summary: A glow lichen is a feature that consist of several glow lichen blocks.

title: Underwater magma
summary: An underwater magma is a feature found underwater in the Overworld.

title: Bamboo (feature)
summary: A bamboo is a feature that consist of bamboo blocks, found throughout old growth taiga biomes.

title: Vines (feature)
summary: Vines are features that consist of a single vines block.

title: Feature
summary: Features (aka. generated features) are small decorators generated in each chunk after terrain generation. This page lists generated features in a Minecraft world.

title: Tooltip
summary: A tooltip is a piece of text that appears when hovering over or focusing on certain elements in the user interfaces, or when switching the held item.

title: Narrator
summary: Pressing Ctrl + B toggles the narrator, a text-to-speech engine that automatically reads chat messages, including the username.

title: Minecraft Legends
summary: Minecraft Legends is an upcoming real-time action strategy video game being developed by Mojang Studios, Xbox Game Studios, and Blackbird Interactive. It is officially slated to release in Q1/Q2 2023.

title: Slot
summary: A slot is a location in the data of a block entity or entity that an item stack can be placed in.

title: Disc Fragment
summary: A disc fragment is a music disc fragment obtained from ancient city loot chests. Nine fragments can be combined in a crafting table to make a music disc named "5".

title: Echo Shard
summary: An echo shard is an item found in ancient cities which can be used to craft recovery compasses.

title: Recovery Compass
summary: A recovery compass is an item used to point to the location of the player's last death.

title: Muddy Mangrove Roots
summary: Muddy mangrove roots are a decorative variant of mangrove roots.

title: Mangrove Roots
summary: Mangrove roots are blocks that form as part of mangrove trees. Despite being a full block, they can be waterlogged.

title: Packed Mud
summary: Packed mud is a block crafted from mud and wheat. It is used to create mud bricks.

title: Mud Bricks
summary: Mud Bricks are a block obtained by crafting 4 packed mud.

title: Copper Horn
summary: A copper horn was an item crafted from a goat horn and copper ingots.

title: Chat
summary:
Chat is a messaging system used to communicate with other players, or to enter commands.
Several of these commands are configurable (the defaults are shown here).

title: Translucency
summary: Translucency is a concept very closely related to transparency. Blocks, items, entities and other game elements said to be translucent allow for vision to pass through them partially, but not fully.

title: Reinforced Deepslate
summary: Reinforced deepslate is a block that spawns in ancient cities. It has high hardness, is immune to explosions and it cannot be obtained in Survival Mode.

title: Swift Sneak
summary: Swift Sneak is a non-renewable enchantment that can be applied to leggings and allows the player to walk more quickly while sneaking.

title: /placefeature command
summary: Places a configured feature at the specified location where meet the placement requirements.

title: Simulation distance
summary: Simulation distance is a world-creation setting in Bedrock Edition that controls mob spawning and despawning, and tick updates. in Java Edition, simulation distance is a video setting related to render distance, to restrict tick update distance.

title: Froglight
summary: A froglight is a light-emitting block that is obtained when a frog eats a tiny magma cube. It comes in three variants based on the variant of frog that eats the magma cube.

title: Frogspawn
summary: Frogspawn is a non-solid block that hatches tadpoles. It is laid by frogs.

title: Minecraft Now
summary: Minecraft Now is a series of online livestreams produced by Mojang Studios, where development information regarding Minecraft is presented, alongside community creations, live gameplay, and a Q&A with the developers. The livestreams began with the first edition on December 9, 2021.

title: Jungle Bush
summary: A jungle bush is one of the rarest plants in the game, they generate in jungles and cannot be grown by jungle saplings.

title: Water lake
summary: A water lake was a small body of water source blocks in the Overworld. It could generate both on the surface and underground, in the latter case an air pocket would generate above it.

title: Ice Patch
summary: Ice patches are blobs of packed ice that generate exclusively in the ice spikes biome.

title: Tadpole
summary: A tadpole is the larval form of the frog. They mature into one of the three frog variants, depending on the biome in which they mature.

title: Mangrove
summary: Mangrove trees are found in mangrove swamps, in which they can grow on water or land. They have large canopies and aerial root systems. Their wood color is vermillion. They can be planted in the air, but their roots always touch the ground.

title: Boat with Chest
summary: A boat with chest is a single chest occupying the passenger seat of a boat, and functions as such. As it can still be driven it can be used to transport items over bodies of water.

title: Allay
summary: The allay ( /əˈleɪ/ uh-ʟᴀʏ) is a small flying passive mob. It collects and delivers items for any player that gives it something, or any note block it hears repeatedly playing.

title: Sky
summary: The sky is a visual feature of Minecraft worlds.

title: /jfr command
summary: Start profiling with Java FlightRecorder as well as a few custom events.

title: Sculk Shrieker
summary: A sculk shrieker is a sculk block found in the deep dark biome that produces a "shrieking" noise when a player either stands on it (regardless of sneaking) or triggers a nearby sculk sensor. Shriekers found in the deep dark can summon the warden when they are triggered.

title: Background
summary: The background is a decorative background of a GUI displayed in the options, end poem, etc.

title: Ancient City
summary: An Ancient City is a palatial structure found in deep dark biomes at layer -51, harboring chests containing some items that cannot be found anywhere else.

title: Meadow
summary: The meadow is an elevated grassy biome filled with patches of flowers and turquoise-green grass and tall grass, where sheep, donkeys and rabbits spawn.

title: /perf command
summary:
Captures information and metrics about the game for ten seconds.
Note that this command can only executed in dedicated server, use F3 + L in client to run performance profiler.

title: Structure Air
summary: Structure air is an invisible block of unknown use.

title: Logo
summary: The Minecraft logo is used in its many forms to represent its franchise and the game.

title: Marker
summary: Markers are entities intended for use in data packs and map-making. They can only be created with the /summon command.

title: Block of Raw Iron
summary: A block of raw iron is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw iron.

title: Block of Raw Copper
summary: A block of raw copper is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw copper.

title: Block of Raw Gold
summary: A block of raw gold is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw gold.

title: Raw Gold
summary: Raw gold is a raw metal resource obtained from mining gold ore.

title: Raw Copper
summary: Raw copper is a raw metal resource obtained from mining copper ore.

title: Raw Iron
summary: Raw iron is a raw metal resource obtained from mining iron ore.

title: Minecraft Plus!
summary: Minecraft Plus! is a screensaver app developed by Mojang Studios for April Fools Day 2021. It features many different Minecraft-themed screen savers, using block and item textures from the game, inspired by screensavers from old computers. The app is available to download for free and runs on 64-bit Windows 7+ PCs. Alternatively, the app can also be used in a modern web browser.

title: Toasts
summary: Toasts are text boxes shown when the player unlocks new crafting recipes or loads up a new world. They serve as a tutorial, to teach the player how to play the game. They show up in the top right corner of the screen.

title: Cobbled Deepslate
summary: Cobbled deepslate is a stone variant that functions similar to cobblestone or blackstone.

title: The Wild Update
summary: The Wild Update is a major update released on June 7, 2022, as Java Edition 1.19 and Bedrock Edition 1.19.0, themed around "scary things" and natural wilderness.

title: Chiseled Deepslate
summary: Chiseled deepslate is the chiseled version of deepslate.

title: Polished Deepslate
summary: Polished deepslate is the stone-like polished version of deepslate.

title: Deepslate Tiles
summary:
Deepslate tiles are a decorative variant of deepslate.
Cracked deepslate tiles are a cracked variant of deepslate.

title: Deepslate Bricks
summary:
Deepslate bricks are the brick version of deepslate.
Cracked deepslate bricks are a cracked variant.

title: Deepslate
summary: Deepslate is a stone type found deep underground in the Overworld that functions similarly to regular stone, but is significantly more difficult to break.

title: Clay blob
summary: Clay blobs were a terrain feature that existed as a way for clay blocks to generate naturally.

title: Small Dripleaf
summary: A  small dripleaf is a plant which generates in lush caves, and is used to grow big dripleaves, a platforming block.

title: Big Dripleaf
summary: A big dripleaf is a plant that generates within lush caves. It may be used as a block for parkour and platforming.

title: Moss Block
summary: A moss block is a natural block that can be spread to some other blocks by using bone meal.

title: Hanging Roots
summary: Hanging roots are a natural decorative block found underground in the lush caves biome.

title: Moss Carpet
summary: A moss carpet is a thin decorative variant of the moss block.

title: Glow Ink Sac
summary: A glow ink sac is an item dropped by a glow squid upon death. Unlike regular ink sacs, it can be added to signs to make glowing text, and can be used to craft glow item frames.

title: Glow Lichen
summary: A glow lichen is a non-solid, light-emitting block. It can generate, or be placed, on any side of a solid block.

title: Panorama
summary: The panorama (also known as the cubemap) is a slowly panning wide-angle view of a Minecraft world displayed on the main menu.

title: Dripstone (feature)
summary: Dripstone features can be found commonly in dripstone caves biomes. There are three types of dripstone feature: Large Dripstone, Dripstone Cluster and Pointed Dripstone (aka. Small Dripstone).

title: Redstone mechanics
summary: Redstone mechanics provide Minecraft with a loose analogue to electricity, which is useful for controlling and activating a variety of mechanisms.

title: Spawn protection
summary: Spawn protection prevents players from building in spawn, undoing any attempts at placing or breaking blocks.

title: Create New World
summary: The "Create New World" screen is a menu screen that allows the player to create a new world.

title: Torch (Burnt-out)
summary: The torch (burnt-out) is a joke feature introduced exclusively in Java Edition 2.0. After a normal torch burns out, the burnt-out torch appears.

title: Item modifier
summary: Item modifiers are technical JSON files that can be created inside data packs and are used to add loot functions into existing items using the command /item.

title: /item command
summary: Manipulate or copy items in the inventories of blocks (chest, furnaces, etc.) or entities (players or mobs).

title: Powder Snow Bucket
summary: A powder snow bucket is a bucket with powder snow inside.

title: Azalea tree
summary: An azalea tree is a rare tree that can generate above a lush cave biome, marking the biome's presence aboveground. A variant of the usual oak tree, they extend their roots underground into the cave beneath.

title: Azalea
summary:
An azalea is a solid block that can be grown into an azalea tree.
A flowering azalea is a variant of azalea that, additionally, counts as a flower for all purposes, including pollination by bees, except crafting dyes.

title: Calcite
summary: Calcite is a carbonate mineral, currently used as a decorative block.

title: Tuff
summary: Tuff is an ornamental rock formed from volcanic ash, occurring in underground blobs below Y=16.

title: Budding Amethyst
summary: Budding amethyst is a fragile block found in amethyst geodes that grows amethyst clusters over time. It cannot be obtained as an item or moved by a piston, necessitating that it be returned to in order to harvest more clusters from it.

title: Candle
summary: A candle is a block that comes in any of the sixteen dye colors, as well as an undyed variant. Candles are placed unlit and can be lit with flint and steel to provide light and extinguished by being used. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

title: Block of Amethyst
summary: A block of amethyst is a decorative block crafted from four amethyst shards.

title: Copper Ingot
summary: Copper ingots are metal ingots obtained from smelting raw copper or killing drowned.

title: Social interactions
summary: The Social Interactions screen is a graphical interface used to disable chatting with certain players.

title: Dripstone Block
summary: The dripstone block is a rock block that allows pointed dripstone to grow beneath it.

title: Sculk Vein
summary: A sculk vein is a block found in the deep dark or generated by sculk catalysts. It can generate or be placed on any side of a solid block.

title: Sculk Catalyst
summary: A sculk catalyst is a block that converts blocks around it to blocks in the sculk family (except for more sculk catalysts) when a mob that drops experience dies nearby.

title: Rooted Dirt
summary: Rooted dirt is a natural decorative block.

title: Spyglass
summary: A spyglass is a tool used to zoom in on distant objects.

title: Deep Dark
summary: The deep dark is a cave biome that generates deep underground in the Overworld.

title: Pointed Dripstone
summary:
Pointed dripstone is a block that makes up stalactites and stalagmites. 
Stalactites (which point downward) can be used as falling projectiles, to renewably drip water and lava into cauldrons and to convert mud into clay. 
Stalagmites (which point upward) deal extra damage to players and mobs that land on them.

title: Amethyst Cluster
summary:
Amethyst buds are the first three stages of growth of amethyst clusters, which grow on budding amethyst.
Amethyst clusters are the fourth and final growth stage of amethyst buds, which drop amethyst shards when mined.

title: Amethyst geode
summary: An amethyst geode is a feature found in the underground of the Overworld. Amethyst geodes contain smooth basalt, calcite, and are the main source of amethyst items and blocks.

title: Block of Copper
summary: The block of copper and cut copper are blocks that oxidize over time, gaining a verdigris appearance over four stages. They can be prevented from oxidising by being waxed with honeycombs. Non-cut, non-oxidised, non-waxed copper blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine copper ingots.

title: Copper Ore
summary:
Copper ore is a mineral block found underground.
Deepslate copper ore is the deepslate variant of copper ore, usually found deeper underground.

title: Amethyst Shard
summary: An amethyst shard is a crystal obtained from mining a fully grown amethyst cluster or can be obtained from chests in ancient cities.

title: Bundle
summary: A bundle is a storage item that can be used for managing items inside the player's inventory, and allows for combination of multiple item types within single inventory slots.

title: Dripstone Caves
summary: The dripstone caves biome is an Overworld cave biome filled with clusters and pillars of pointed dripstone and dripstone blocks.

title: Sculk
summary: Sculk is a block found abundantly in the deep dark or converted from other blocks by a sculk catalyst. Like most of the rest of the sculk family it drops experience when broken by a tool that is not enchanted with Silk Touch.

title: Sculk Sensor
summary: The sculk sensor is a sculk block that detects vibrations caused by actions and events and emits a redstone signal and triggers nearby sculk shriekers. Players can sneak to avoid making vibrations and wool can be used to occlude and block them.

title: Glow Berries
summary:
Glow berries are a food item that is collected from cave vines and can be used to plant them.
Cave vines are a plant used to grow glow berries.

title: Warden
summary: The warden is a hostile mob summoned by sculk shriekers in deep dark biomes. It has the highest health and deals the highest melee damage of all mobs. It can also fire ranged sonic boom attacks that bypass blocks and almost all damage-reducing items, including enchanted armor. The warden is completely blind and relies on vibrations and its sense of smell to detect players and mobs to attack.

title: Spore Blossom
summary: A spore blossom is a ceiling-hanging decorative block that emits green particles.

title: Lush Caves
summary: A lush cave is a temperate Overworld cave biome that has a unique fauna and flora and is found underground below azalea trees.

title: Caves & Cliffs
summary: Caves & Cliffs is the name of two major themed updates for Java and Bedrock editions.

title: /ride command
summary: Allows entities to mount or dismount other entities.

title: /structure command
summary: Used to save and load structures without having to use structure blocks.

title: Texture atlas
summary: A texture atlas, also known as a spritesheet, is an arrangement of game sprites on a single image file, used by the game to store and access associated sprites more efficiently than with individual files. Minecraft uses both procedurally-generated and predefined texture atlases for different purposes.

title: Custom world generation
summary: Custom world generation allows data packs to change how the world generate.

title: Custom biome
summary: Biomes stored as JSON files within a data pack in the path data/<namespace>/worldgen/biome.

title: Piglin Brute
summary: A piglin brute is a hostile and stronger variant of piglins that appears in all types of bastion remnants. They always attack the player. They do not barter, they do not retreat, and they cannot be distracted by gold.

title: Block update
summary: A block update is an in-game mechanism that occurs when a block is modified in some way.

title: Powder Snow
summary: Powder snow is a block found in snowy slopes and grove biomes, or collected from snowfall using cauldrons.  Players and most mobs fall through powder snow and take freezing damage within it, but leather boots can be worn to stand on and climb through it as well as gain freezing immunity. Powder snow can only be obtained using a bucket.

title: Lightning Rod
summary: A lightning rod is a block used to divert lightning strikes.

title: Darkness
summary: Darkness is a status effect that causes the player's vision to temporarily deteriorate. The effect is caused by the activation of a sculk shrieker, or by being within detection range of a warden.

title: Goat Horn
summary: A goat horn is an item dropped by goats. It has eight variants, and each plays a unique sound when used which can be heard by players in a large radius.

title: Mud
summary: Mud is a block found abundantly in mangrove swamps or created by using a water bottle on a dirt block. It can be used for crafting or converted into clay using pointed dripstone.

title: Void start platform
summary: Void start platforms are a feature of 33×33 square of stone with a single block of cobblestone in the center. One can generate at the origin of a Superflat world if in the_void biome.

title: Hitbox
summary: A hitbox defines the physical "boundaries" (or an approximation thereof) of a block or entity.

title: Loading world screen
summary: The loading world screen is a screen displayed when generating or loading a world. It shows the percentage of the loading progress.

title: /attribute command
summary: Used to change or read attributes.

title: Basalt columns
summary: Basalt columns are vertical clusters of basalt blocks found within basalt delta biomes. They may also contain lava and magma in the many gaps between the towers.

title: Ruined portal
summary: A ruined portal is a naturally generated damaged nether portal, which spawns in both the Nether and the Overworld. It contains some decoration and a loot chest around it.

title: Gilded Blackstone
summary: Gilded blackstone is a variant of blackstone that can drop itself or gold nuggets when mined.

title: Polished Blackstone Bricks
summary:
Polished blackstone bricks are a decorative version of polished blackstone.
 Cracked polished blackstone bricks is the cracked version of polished blackstone bricks.

title: Polished Blackstone
summary:
Polished blackstone is the stone-like polished variation of blackstone.
 Chiseled polished blackstone is the chiseled variation of polished blackstone.

title: Blackstone
summary: Blackstone is a dark-colored block that functions similar to cobblestone or cobbled deepslate. It can be found only in the Nether.

title: Basalt Deltas
summary: The basalt deltas is a volcanic biome situated in the Nether.

title: Permission level
summary:
Permission level is used to describe permissions of a player or a command executor.
For example, in Bedrock Edition, /setmaxplayers can't be executed in a command block, because this command requires executor to have permission of level 3, while command blocks have a permission level of only 1.

title: Zoglin
summary: Zoglins are undead hostile mobs created when a hoglin enters the Overworld or End. They attack all mobs (and armor stands) indiscriminately, with the exception of other zoglins and creepers.

title: Swaggiest stairs ever
summary: The swaggiest stairs ever is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ which is the stair variant for the netherite block.

title: Warped Fungus on a Stick
summary: A warped fungus on a stick is an item that can be used to control saddled striders.

title: Strider
summary: Striders are passive mobs native to the Nether. They can walk/stride on lava and be saddled by the player. A warped fungus on a stick is needed to control a strider, similar to how a pig is controlled by a carrot on a stick.

title: Lodestone
summary: A lodestone is a block that can be used to alter compasses to point toward it. It can be used in all three dimensions.

title: Glow Squid
summary: The glow squid is an aquatic passive mob found in dark underwater areas, typically in ocean depths, ravines and underground lakes. The glow squid is a variety of squid. It has an aqua luminescent texture. They were ported to vanilla Minecraft from Minecraft Earth.

title: Respawn Anchor
summary: The respawn anchor is a block that allows players to set their spawn point in the Nether.

title: Soul Speed
summary: Soul Speed is an enchantment that can be applied on boots and allows the player to walk more quickly on soul sand and soul soil.

title: Twisting Vines
summary: Twisting vines are climbable upward-growing vegetation blocks found in the Nether in warped forests.

title: Nether Gold Ore
summary: Nether gold ore is a variant of gold ore found only in the Nether.

title: Bartering
summary: Bartering is an action the player can perform with piglins to obtain various items.

title: Bastion Remnant
summary: Bastion remnants are large, castle-like generated structures found in the Nether in all of the biomes except basalt deltas. They generate in four distinct variants, each with a unique structure and set of loot. Piglins and piglin brutes spawn in these structures on generation, and hoglins may also spawn on generation in the bridge and hoglin stables variants. Bastion remnants are the only place to find gilded blackstone, the Pigstep music disc, the snout banner pattern, and the magma cube monster spawner.

title: Roots
summary: Roots are a non-solid "plant" block that come in two variants, crimson roots and warped roots, which generate naturally on warped or crimson nylium and soul soil in their respective biomes. They resemble a colony of tall, thin mushrooms.

title: Nether Sprouts
summary: Nether sprouts are a non-solid fungi block that generate in warped forests.

title: Weeping Vines
summary: Weeping vines are climbable downwards-growing vegetation blocks found in the Nether in crimson forests.

title: Huge fungus
summary: A huge fungus is a large "tree" structure that generates in the Nether. There are two types of huge fungi: the huge crimson fungus and the huge warped fungus.

title: Crimson Forest
summary: The crimson forest is a forested biome in the Nether.

title: Fungus
summary: A fungus is a mushroom-like block that generates in the Nether. There are two types of fungi: crimson and warped.

title: Warped Forest
summary: The warped forest is a biome found in the Nether. It is a relatively safe biome because no hostile mobs spawn there naturally.

title: Nether Fossil
summary: Nether fossils are fossils that generate in soul sand valleys.

title: Nylium
summary: Nylium is a variant of netherrack that generates in the Nether. It has two variants: warped nylium and crimson nylium which both spawn in different biomes.

title: Netherite Scrap
summary: Netherite scrap is a material smelted from ancient debris, which is found in the Nether. It is used solely for crafting netherite ingots. Like all netherite-related items, it is not flammable.

title: Shroomlight
summary: Shroomlights are light-emitting blocks that generate in huge fungi.

title: Ancient Debris
summary: Ancient debris is a rare ore found in the Nether, and is the main source of netherite scraps. Its high blast resistance makes it immune to normal explosions. In item form, it floats on lava and cannot be burned by any form of fire.

title: /locatebiome command
summary: Displays the coordinates for the closest biome of a given biome ID or a biome tag in the chat for the player who executed the command.

title: Block of Netherite
summary: A block of netherite is a precious metal block made from nine netherite ingots. Unlike most items, it is resistant to fire and lava.

title: Netherite Ingot
summary: Netherite ingots are items obtained from crafting netherite scraps and gold ingots together, as well as loot from bastion remnant loot chests.  Unlike other items, they are immune to fire and lava damage. They are primarily used to upgrade diamond gear and craft lodestones.

title: Basalt
summary:
Basalt is an igneous rock found in the Nether.
 Polished basalt is the polished version of basalt and can be found as part of ancient cities.
 Smooth basalt is an ornamental rock smelted from basalt or found as part of amethyst geodes and ancient cities.

title: Soul Soil
summary: Soul soil is a block found abundantly in soul sand valleys. Unlike soul sand it does not slow down players or mobs that walk on it.

title: Buzzy Bees
summary: Buzzy Bees was a major update, mainly focused on bees and the items relating to them, as well as also fixing bugs from previous versions.

title: Basalt pillar
summary: Basalt pillars are tall features made up of basalt block.

title: Drinks
summary: Drinks are a narrow class of consumable items that can be ingested by the player in an extremely similar manner to food.

title: Hoglin
summary: A hoglin is a breedable hostile mob found in the Nether, and a source of porkchops and leather. Hoglins are repelled by warped fungi, but only if it is placed in the world.

title: /spectate command
summary: Causes a player in Spectator mode to spectate another entity.

title: Honeycomb Block
summary: Honeycomb blocks are decorative blocks crafted from honeycombs.

title: Target
summary: A target is a block that provides a temporary redstone charge when hit by a projectile. Unlike all other redstone-conductive blocks it also redirects adjacent redstone dust towards it.

title: Soul Sand Valley
summary: A soul sand valley is a dry biome located in the Nether. It is formed of large caverns with nether fossils and different blocks, mainly including soul sand and soul soil.

title: Nether Update
summary: The Nether Update is a major update themed around revamping the Nether.

title: Honey Block
summary: Honey blocks are storage blocks equivalent to four honey bottles. Honey blocks are sticky and can be used in conjunction with pistons to move blocks and adhered entities.

title: Goat
summary: A goat is a neutral mob found in certain mountainous biomes. Goats can jump especially high and ram mobs. They are a source of goat horns and milk.

title: Mob Vote
summary:
Mob Vote may refer to:

The 2017 Mob Vote
The 2018 China Edition Mob Vote
The 2020 Mob Vote
The 2021 Mob Vote
The 2022 Mob Vote

title: Frog
summary: A frog is a passive mob found in swamps. Frogs eat small slimes and magma cubes. A frog can produce one of three kinds of Froglights from eating magma cubes, depending on the type of frog.

title: Predicate
summary: Predicates are JSON structures found in multiple different locations within data packs.

title: Lying
summary: Lying is a body position adopted by the player and some other mobs under certain circumstances.

title: Light Block
summary: Light blocks (in Bedrock Edition) or lights (in Java Edition) are invisible blocks, primarily intended for map makers, that can produce any light level from 0 to 15. The light block is also the only light-emitting block capable of producing light level 8.

title: Beehive
summary: Bee nests and beehives are blocks that house bees, with bee nests being natural and beehives crafted. They fill with honey as bees pollinate flowers and return to their homes and, when full, can either be sheared for honeycombs or honey bottles extracted using glass bottles.

title: Honeycomb
summary: Honeycombs are items obtained from bee nests and beehives.

title: Honey Bottle
summary: A honey bottle is a consumable drink item obtainable by using a glass bottle on a full beehive.  Honey bottles remove poison when drunk and can be used to craft honey blocks and sugar.

title: Bee
summary: Bees are flying neutral mobs that live in bee nests and beehives. Bees pollinate flowers and, when they do, add honey to their home when they return to it. When full, bee nests or beehives can be harvested with shears for honeycombs or glass bottles for honey bottles. If provoked by being attacked or breaking or harvesting their hive or nest without the correct precautions, bees suicidally attack in a swarm.

title: 2×2 grid
summary: The 2×2 crafting grid is used for basic crafting using a subset of the possible crafting recipes.

title: Minecraft Dungeons
summary: Minecraft Dungeons is an action-adventure role-playing video game developed by Mojang Studios, Xbox Game Studios and Double Eleven.

title: Sitting
summary: Sitting is a game mechanic used by the player and some mobs under specific circumstances.

title: Minecraft Earth
summary: Minecraft Earth was a free-to-play augmented reality (AR) spin-off mobile game developed by Mojang Studios and published by Xbox Game Studios for iOS, iPadOS, and Android. The game was about building structures and collecting materials by traveling to real-life locations. Minecraft Earth was released in closed beta on July 16, 2019, and gradually expanded its available countries over the rest of 2019, being released worldwide on December 11, 2019. The game received its final update, 0.33.0, on January 5, 2021, and was discontinued on June 30, 2021, due to restrictions on outdoor activities as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. The next day, all players that had a remaining paid balance of Rubies were given Minecoins, and players who purchased anything in the game received a copy of Bedrock Edition in return.

title: Crawling
summary: Crawling is a mechanic that prevents the player from suffocating when inside small gaps. Crawling covers a pose that occurs when the player is in an area less than 1.5 blocks high.

title: Wither (effect)
summary: Wither is a status effect that inflicts damage over time.

title: Resistance
summary: Resistance is a status effect that reduces incoming damage.

title: Hero of the Village
summary: Hero of the Village is a status effect granted to the player upon defeating a raid.

title: Wandering Trader
summary: The wandering trader is a passive mob that randomly spawns near the player. It can trade, making natural items more available, less dangerous to obtain, and in some cases, renewable.

title: Donkey
summary: Donkeys are variants of horses that, when tamed, can be ridden and equipped with chests.

title: Mule
summary: Mules are infertile offspring of horses and donkeys that, when tamed, can be ridden and equipped with chests.

title: Raid captain
summary: A raid captain is the occurrence of an illager spawning with an Ominous Banner (in Java Edition) / Illager Banner (in Bedrock Edition) on top of its head, usually a pillager or vindicator, or rarely in Java Edition an evoker.

title: Composter
summary: A composter is a block that converts some biological material into bone meal. It also serves as a farmer villager's job site block.

title: Axolotl
summary: An axolotl is a passive aquatic mob endemic to the lush caves biome that hunts most other aquatic mobs.

title: /teammsg command
summary: Sends message to all players in the team of the entity who runs the command.

title: Raid
summary: A raid is an in-game event in which waves of various mobs, mainly illagers, spawn and attack a village. It is triggered when a player with the Bad Omen status effect enters a village.

title: Pillager Outpost
summary: A pillager outpost is an assortment of structures inhabited by pillagers.

title: Bad Omen
summary: Bad Omen is a status effect that causes a raid to appear when an afflicted player enters a village. This does not apply to any other mob with the effect if the mob is in a village.

title: Jigsaw Block
summary: Jigsaw blocks are technical blocks used in the generation of some structures.

title: Patrol
summary: A patrol‌ or pillager patrol‌ is a rare, naturally-spawning group of pillagers.

title: Grindstone
summary: A grindstone is a block that repairs items and tools as well as removing enchantments from them, except for curses. It also serves as a weaponsmith's job site block.

title: Bell
summary: A bell is a transparent, animated block entity that produces a sound when used. Unlike most utility blocks, bells cannot be crafted.

title: Smithing Table
summary: A smithing table is a utility block used to upgrade diamond gear into netherite gear, a process that keeps all enchantments. It also serves as a toolsmith's job site block.

title: Barrel
summary: A barrel is a solid block used to store items. Unlike a chest it cannot connect to other barrels and blocks placed above it do not prevent it from opening. It also serves as a fisherman's job site block.

title: Blast Furnace
summary: A blast furnace is a block that smelts ores, raw metals and metal armor and tools twice as quickly as a furnace but cannot smelt anything else. It also serves as an armorer's job site block.

title: Cartography Table
summary: A cartography table is a utility block used for cloning, zooming out and locking maps. It also serves as a cartogropher's job site block.

title: Smoker
summary: A smoker is a block that smelts food twice as quickly as a furnace but cannot smelt anything else. It also serves as a butcher's job site block.

title: Fletching Table
summary: A fletching table is a fletcher's job site block that can generate naturally in villages. The fletching table is used to turn an unemployed villager into a Fletcher.

title: /schedule command
summary: In Java Edition, delays the execution of a function.

title: Banner Pattern
summary:
Banner patterns are items used to customize banners inside looms.
There are six patterns in Java Edition and eight in Bedrock Edition.

title: Loom
summary: A loom is used to apply patterns to banners. It also serves as a shepherd's job site block.

title: Suspicious Stew
summary: Suspicious stew is a food item that can give the player a status effect that depends on the flower used to craft it.

title: Piercing
summary: Piercing is an enchantment applied to a crossbow that causes arrows to pierce through entities.

title: Quick Charge
summary: Quick Charge is an enchantment for quickly reloading a crossbow.

title: Multishot
summary: Multishot is an enchantment for crossbows that allow them to shoot three arrows or firework rockets at the cost of one.

title: Brown Dye
summary: Brown dye is a primary color dye derived from cocoa beans.

title: White Dye
summary: White dye is a primary color dye similar to bone meal.

title: Campfire
summary: A campfire is a block that can be used to cook food, pacify bees, act as a spread-proof light source, smoke signal or damaging trap block.

title: Sweet Berries
summary:
Sweet berries are a food item that are collected from sweet berry bushes.
Sweet berry bushes are thorny plants used to grow sweet berries.

title: Scaffolding
summary: Scaffolding is a climbable semi-solid block that can be stood on without falling as well as be placed and broken easily.

title: Fox
summary: A fox is a tameable passive mob that spawns in taigas, old growth taigas, snowy taigas and mountain groves. They are able to carry a single item in their mouth, but prefer food over other items.

title: Pillager
summary: Pillagers are hostile mobs armed with crossbows found in wandering patrols or as participants in raids. They attack by firing arrows at the player.

title: Crossbow
summary: A crossbow is a ranged weapon similar to a bow that uses arrows or fireworks as ammunition.

title: Ravager
summary: Ravagers are large hostile mobs that spawn in raids and attack players, villagers (excluding baby villagers), wandering traders, and iron golems. They attack by charging at players to ram them, but can also roar if they were stopped by a shield.

title: Panda
summary: A panda is a rare neutral mob that resides in jungles. Certain aspects of a panda's behavior and appearance vary depending on its personality.

title: Village & Pillage
summary: Village & Pillage was a major update themed around revamping villages that was released for versions of Minecraft in 2019, with the exception of the Xbox 360 Edition, Xbox One Edition, PlayStation 3 Edition, PlayStation Vita Edition, Wii U Edition, and New Nintendo 3DS Edition.

title: /forceload command
summary: Force chunks to load constantly or not, forceload add, forceload query and forceload remove are three separated commands.

title: Pufferfish (item)
summary: A pufferfish is a poisonous food item that is used to brew Water Breathing potions.

title: Tropical Fish (item)
summary: Tropical fish is a food item that cannot be cooked.

title: Waterlogging
summary: Waterlogging is the mechanic that allows non-cube blocks (that is, blocks that do not completely fill their block volume, such as doors, ladders, and plants) to be filled with a water source block.

title: Ice spike
summary: Ice spikes are common features made of ice. Ice spikes only generate in Ice Spikes biomes.

title: Pause menu
summary: The pause menu is one of Minecraft's multiple menu screens.

title: Dolphin's Grace
summary: Dolphin's Grace is a status effect that increases the player's swimming speed when a dolphin is nearby.

title: Glow Stick
summary: Glow sticks are chemistry-related items, which can be lit up in the player's hand for a limited time.

title: Conduit Power
summary: Conduit Power is an area-of-effect status effect given by conduits that grants bonuses comparable to a combination of Water Breathing, Night Vision (only underwater), and Haste (only underwater).

title: Bubble Column
summary: A bubble column is a non-solid block generated by placing magma blocks or soul sand in water (source). Bubble columns push or pull entities and items in certain directions.

title: Hardened Glass
summary: Hardened glass is a type of glass that has been chemically strengthened. It is available in clear and colored variants, similarly to normal glass.

title: Slow Falling
summary: Slow Falling is a status effect that causes the affected mob to fall slower and take no fall damage, but does not prevent ender pearl damage.

title: Conduit
summary: A conduit is a beacon-like block that provides Conduit Power and attacks hostile mobs underwater.

title: Sea Pickle
summary: A sea pickle is a small block that emits light underwater, and is typically found in colonies of up to four sea pickles.

title: Phantom Membrane
summary: Phantom membranes are obtained from killing phantoms.

title: Blue Ice
summary: Blue ice is a solid block similar to packed ice and ice, but much more slippery.

title: Swimming
summary: Swimming is a form of transportation that allows the player to move in water.

title: Drowned
summary: Drowned are common underwater zombie variants that spawn in oceans, rivers and dripstone caves, or when zombies drown. They usually attack through melee attacks, but may also come armed with tridents that they throw. They are the only source of tridents, and the only renewable source of copper.

title: Coral reef
summary: Coral reefs are features that generate in warm ocean biomes. They consist of multiple clusters of coral blocks, coral, and coral fans. These clusters come in a wide variety of shapes, sizes, and colors.

title: Buried treasure
summary: Buried treasure is a naturally generated structure that consists of a buried loot chest. The chest is buried primarily in beaches, and rarely in the ocean floor. Buried treasure is the only source of the heart of the sea, which can be used to craft a conduit. Buried treasure can be located using explorer maps.

title: Cod
summary: Cod are common passive aquatic mobs found in oceans.

title: Bucket of aquatic mob
summary: A bucket of aquatic mob is a form of a water bucket with an aquatic mob (a fish, axolotl, or tadpole) inside.

title: Channeling
summary: Channeling is a trident enchantment that produces lightning.

title: Riptide
summary: Riptide is an enchantment exclusive to tridents, which hurls the user in the direction the user is facing, but only when they are wet.

title: Impaling
summary: Impaling is an enchantment for a trident, causing the trident to deal extra damage on each hit against aquatic mobs‌, or extra damage to mobs in water‌.

title: Loyalty
summary: Loyalty is an enchantment applying to a trident, causing it to return to the owner once thrown. If the player dies while the trident is returning, the trident then drops in item form and is susceptible to despawning.

title: Dried Kelp
summary: Dried kelp is a food item that can be quickly eaten by the player. It can also be crafted into dried kelp blocks.

title: Scute
summary: Scutes are items that baby turtles drop when they grow into adults. They can be used to craft turtle shells which can be used to brew the potion of the Turtle Master.

title: Dried Kelp Block
summary: Dried kelp blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine dried kelp that can also be used as fuel.

title: Seagrass
summary:
Seagrass is a non-solid plant block that generates in all oceans, except frozen oceans.
Tall seagrass is a two-block high variety of seagrass.

title: Petrified Oak Slab
summary: Petrified oak slabs are a unique type of slab available through commands or by upgrading from legacy versions. Unlike all other slabs, they are unobtainable through conventional Survival gameplay and the only way to obtain them is through commands.

title: Smooth Quartz Block
summary: A smooth quartz block is a mineral block used only for decoration. It is made by smelting blocks of quartz.

title: /bossbar command
summary: Creates and modifies boss bars.

title: Turtle Egg
summary: A turtle egg (in Java Edition) or sea turtle egg (in Bedrock Edition) is a block containing 1–4 eggs that each hatch into a baby turtle.

title: Shipwreck
summary: A shipwreck is a sailing ship structure found in oceanic biomes.

title: Trident
summary: A trident is a weapon used in both melee and ranged combat and is a rare drop from drowned.

title: Turtle
summary: A turtle (in Java Edition), also known as a sea turtle (in Bedrock Edition), is a common passive mob found in beach biomes. They are the only source of scutes, which drop from baby turtles when they mature into adults.

title: China Edition
summary: Minecraft: China Edition is a localized edition of Java and Bedrock editions for mainland China, developed by Mojang Studios and NetEase. China Edition has 600 million players as of October 2022.

title: Debug Stick
summary: The debug stick is an item used to edit the block states of blocks. It is visually identical to a regular stick, but with a glint (as if enchanted).

title: Phantom
summary: Phantoms are flying undead hostile mobs that spawn in the night sky when the player has not laid in a bed or died for three or more in-game days. They attack by diving at the player from the sky to bite them.

title: Dolphin
summary: Dolphins are neutral mobs  that live in non-frozen oceans, which grant a speed boost to players that swim near them.

title: Kelp
summary: Kelp is an underwater plant that generates in most oceans.

title: Update Aquatic
summary: The Update Aquatic is the name for a major update that was released for most versions of Minecraft in 2018, with the exception of the Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and New Nintendo 3DS editions.

title: /data command
summary: The /data command allows the user to get, merge, modify, and remove NBT data of a block entity, entity, or Command NBT storage.

title: /datapack command
summary: Controls the loading/unloading of data packs.

title: /tag command
summary: Controls scoreboard tags on individual entities.

title: /team command
summary: Controls teams.

title: Data pack
summary: The data pack system provides a way for players to further customize their Minecraft experience. Data packs can be used to override or add new advancements, dimensions, functions, loot tables, predicates, recipes, structures, tags, world generation settings, and biomes without any code modification.

title: /loot command
summary: Drops the given loot table into the specified inventory or into the world.

title: /experience command
summary: Adds or removes player experience.

title: /worldborder command
summary: These commands control the world border.

title: /whitelist command
summary: Whitelist is used to manage server whitelists.

title: /weather command
summary: Sets the weather.

title: /trigger command
summary: Modifies a scoreboard objective with a "trigger" criterion. Allows non-operator players to modify their own scoreboard objectives under tightly controlled conditions. Often used to let players activate systems controlled by data packs or command blocks.

title: /time command
summary: Changes or queries the world's game time.

title: /msg command
summary: Sends a private message to one or more players. /tell or /w can also be used.

title: /teleport command
summary: Teleports entities (players, mobs, etc.).

title: /stop command
summary: Stops a server.

title: /spreadplayers command
summary: Teleports entities to random surface locations within an area.

title: /spawnpoint command
summary: Sets the spawn point for a player. It works in all dimensions.

title: /seed command
summary: Displays the world seed.

title: /scoreboard command
summary: Manages and displays scores for various scoreboard objectives.

title: /say command
summary: Sends a message in the chat.

title: /recipe command
summary: Gives or takes (unlocks or locks) recipes for players.

title: /reload command
summary: Reloads data packs in Java Edition and functions in behavior packs in Bedrock Edition.

title: /particle command
summary: Creates particles.

title: /op command
summary: Grants operator status to a player.

title: /me command
summary: Displays a message about yourself.

title: /list command
summary: Lists players on the server.

title: /kill command
summary: Kills entities (players, mobs, items, etc.).

title: /kick command
summary: Kicks a player off the server.

title: /gamerule command
summary: Sets or queries a game rule value.

title: /gamemode command
summary: Sets a player's game mode.

title: /function command
summary: Runs commands founds in the corresponding function file.

title: /entitydata command
summary: Modifies the data tag of an entity.

title: /enchant command
summary: Adds an enchantment to a player's selected item, subject to the same restrictions as an anvil. Also works on any mob or entity holding a weapon/tool/armor in its main hand.

title: /effect command
summary: Add or remove status effects on players and other entities.

title: /difficulty command
summary: Sets the difficulty level (peaceful, easy, etc.).

title: /deop command
summary: Revokes operator status from a player.

title: /clear command
summary: Clears items from player inventory, including items being dragged by the player.

title: /advancement command
summary: Gives or takes an advancement from one or more players.

title: Java Edition
summary: Minecraft: Java Edition (formerly just Minecraft) is the original version of Minecraft, developed by Mojang Studios for Windows, macOS, and Linux. Notch began development on May 10, 2009, publicly releasing Minecraft on May 17, 2009. The full release of the game (version 1.0.0) was on November 18, 2011, at MINECON 2011.

title: Arthropods
summary: The term arthropod refers to an in-game classification regrouping all bug-like mobs.

title: Tag
summary: Tags in data packs‌ and behavior packs‌ allow players to group different game elements together.

title: Illusioner
summary: An illusioner is an unused illager that is armed with a bow. They mainly attack by shooting arrows with it, but can also attack with illusion or blindness spells.

title: Recipe book
summary: The recipe book is a mechanic in Minecraft that serves as a catalog of recipes and as a crafting, smelting, and banner patterning guide.

title: Knowledge Book
summary: A knowledge book is a utility item that reveals available crafting recipes to the player when used.

title: Parrot
summary: Parrots are rare tameable mobs found in jungles. Parrots can imitate sounds of nearby hostile mobs and can perch on the player's shoulders.

title: /setworldspawn command
summary: Sets the world spawn.

title: Concrete Powder
summary: Concrete powder is a gravity-affected block that is converted to concrete when touching water or lava. It comes in the 16 regular dye colors.

title: Concrete
summary: Concrete is a solid block available in the 16 regular dye colors.

title: /ban command
summary: These commands control a server's banlist, or blacklist. A blacklist is a list of players or IP addresses that are not allowed to connect to the server. Bans supersede any whitelisting in place.

title: Sweeping Edge
summary: Sweeping Edge is a sword enchantment that increases sweep attack damage.

title: Iron Nugget
summary: Iron nuggets are pieces of iron that can be obtained by smelting iron tools/weapons or iron/chainmail armor. One iron nugget is worth one-ninth of an iron ingot.

title: Curse of Vanishing
summary: Curse of Vanishing is an enchantment that causes the item to disappear upon death.

title: Curse of Binding
summary: Curse of Binding is an enchantment that prevents removal of a cursed item from its armor slot.

title: /locate command
summary: Displays the coordinates for the closest generated structure or biomes of a given type in the chat for the player who executed the command. In Java Edition, it can also display for the closest points of interest.

title: Illager
summary: An illager is a type of hostile mob that regularly spawns in woodland mansions, patrols, raids, and pillager outposts. All illagers are hostile toward players, villagers (excluding baby villagers), wandering traders and iron golems.

title: Explorer Map
summary: An explorer map is a special map used to aid in finding rare generated structures, including woodland mansions, ocean monuments, and buried treasures.

title: Llama
summary:
A llama is a tamable neutral mob used to transport large shipments of items.
A trader llama is a special variant that follows wandering traders.

title: Vindicator
summary: A vindicator is an illager equipped with an iron axe. Vindicators appear in woodland mansions and participate in raids. It sprints towards its targets to attack them with its axe.

title: Vex
summary: The vex is a small flying hostile mob. It wields an iron sword, can phase through walls, and is only summoned as one of the evoker's attacks. They attack by lunging at their targets with their sword.

title: Evoker
summary: An evoker is a spell-casting illager found in woodland mansions and raids, and is the only source of the totem of undying. It uses two spells to attack; one that summons armor-piercing fangs and one that summons vexes.

title: Woodland Mansion
summary: A woodland mansion is a massive systematically-generated structure found in dark forests, often far away from the world spawn point. A mansion is inhabited by evokers and vindicators, and is one of the few places where a totem of undying can be obtained, aside from raids. Besides illager mobs, a mansion's interior lighting is sufficiently low for other overworld monsters to spawn.

title: Totem of Undying
summary: A totem of undying is an uncommon combat item that can save holders from death. It is dropped by evokers, which spawn in woodland mansions and raids.

title: Shulker Shell
summary: Shulker shells are items dropped by shulkers that are used solely to craft shulker boxes.

title: Shulker Box
summary: A shulker box is a block that can store and transport items.

title: Exploration Update
summary: The Exploration Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.11, a major update released on November 14, 2016.

title: Frostburn Update
summary:
The Frostburn Update is the name for Java Edition 1.10, a major update released on 
June 8, 2016.

title: Observer
summary: An observer is a block that emits a redstone signal when the block or fluid it faces experiences a change.

title: Walking
summary: Walking is one of the fundamental methods of transportation in Minecraft, allowing for a reasonable movement speed while avoiding the hunger impact of sprinting, but without the fall safety of sneaking.

title: Structure Void
summary: A structure void is an invisible block that allows existing blocks to remain unchanged rather than be overridden when using the structure block to load a structure.

title: Fossil
summary: A fossil is a rarely-occurring skeletal feature composed of bone blocks, coal ore, or diamond ore.

title: Nether Wart Block
summary:
Nether wart blocks are decorative blocks found in crimson forests and crafted using nether wart.
Warped wart blocks are a turquoise variant found in warped forests, but cannot be crafted unlike nether wart block.

title: Bone Block
summary: Bone blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine pieces of bone meal.

title: Stray
summary: A stray is a variant of a skeleton that spawns in a few snow-covered biomes. They behave similarly to skeletons, except they fire tipped arrows of Slowness from their bows.

title: Magma Block
summary: A magma block is a light-emitting naturally-occurring block found in the Nether and the Overworld. It causes continuous damage while being stepped on, considered fire damage, except it does not light mobs on fire.

title: Husk
summary: A husk is a variant of a zombie that spawns in deserts. They function similar to zombies, except they do not burn in sunlight and inflict Hunger with their unarmed attacks.

title: Tinted Glass
summary: Tinted glass is a block that blocks light while being visually transparent.

title: /title command
summary: Controls text displayed on the screen.

title: Polar Bear
summary: Polar bears are neutral mobs that live in icy biomes.

title: /replaceitem command
summary: Replaces the items in a specified slot of either a block's (chest, furnaces, etc.) or entity's (players or mobs) inventory, with a specified item.

title: Chorus plant
summary: A chorus plant is a plant-like feature that generates in the highlands of the outer End islands.

title: Luck
summary: Luck is a status effect that makes it more likely to receive better loot from certain loot tables, contrary to Bad Luck.

title: Bad Luck
summary: Bad Luck, also known as Unluck, is a status effect that decreases the chance of the player getting high-quality loot, contrary to Luck.

title: Loot table
summary: Loot tables are technical JSON files that are used to dictate what items should generate in various situations, such as what items should be in naturally generated containers, what items should drop when breaking a block or killing a mob, what items can be fished, and more. It does not affect dropped experience, or dropped non-item entities such as slimes from larger slimes or silverfish from infested blocks.

title: Igloo
summary: Igloos are structures that are naturally generated in snowy biomes. They are small round structures constructed primarily of snow blocks.

title: Frosted Ice
summary: Frosted ice is a translucent solid block.

title: Frost Walker
summary: Frost Walker is an enchantment to boots that creates frosted ice blocks when walking over water, and causes the wearer to be immune to damage from certain blocks such as campfires and magma blocks when stepped on.

title: Mending
summary: Mending is an enchantment that restores durability of an item using experience.

title: Elytra
summary: Elytra ( /ˈɛl ɪ trə/ ᴇʟ-i-trə) are rare wings found in end ships that are a source of flight in Survival mode.

title: Sound
summary: Sounds are an auditory output of the game intended to communicate the happening of certain events.

title: Black Dye
summary: Black dye is a primary color dye similar to an ink sac.

title: Shield
summary: A shield is a tool used for protecting the player against attacks.

title: Lingering Potion
summary: Lingering potions are variants of splash potions that can be thrown to leave clouds with status effects that linger on the ground in an area.

title: Dragon's Breath
summary: The dragon's breath is a brewing item that is used solely to make lingering potions.

title: End Portal (block)
summary: The end portal block is a block generated when an end portal or exit portal is activated, which teleports the player between the Overworld and the End.

title: Obsidian Boat
summary: The obsidian boat was a joke boat variant released in an April Fools' joke version.

title: End Gateway (block)
summary: The end gateway is a block that forms a part of end gateways, which teleport the player between the main island and the outer islands in the End.

title: Levitation
summary: Levitation is a status effect that causes entities to levitate, inflicted when entities are shot by shulkers.

title: Structure Block
summary: A structure block is used to generate structures manually. They can also be used to save and load structures, alongside structure void blocks.

title: Glowing
summary: Glowing is a status effect that shows entity positions through blocks.

title: End gateway
summary: End gateways are portals generated in the End: some are spawned around the central island by defeating the ender dragon multiple times; others are randomly generated throughout the outer islands.

title: Popped Chorus Fruit
summary: Popped chorus fruit is an item obtained by smelting chorus fruit, and used to craft end rods and purpur blocks. Unlike raw chorus fruit, the popped fruit is inedible.

title: Purpur Block
summary:
Purpur blocks and purpur pillars are decorative blocks that are naturally generated in end cities and end ships.
Chiseled purpur and smooth purpur are two further variants of purpur blocks exclusive to Bedrock Edition that can be accessed only by commands, and appear identical to regular purpur blocks.

title: End Stone Bricks
summary: End stone bricks are an end stone-based brick.

title: Chorus Flower
summary: Chorus flowers are plants that are found in the End. They grow on chorus plants.

title: End City
summary: End cities are castle-like structures found on the outer islands of the End. They are inhabited by shulkers and hold loot among the most valuable in the game.

title: End Rod
summary: An end rod is a decorative light source that emits white particles.

title: Shulker
summary: A shulker is a box-shaped hostile mob found in end cities. It hides in its shell to protect itself and blend in with its surroundings. It attacks by shooting homing bullets at the player which inflict Levitation. It is the only source of shulker shells, which are used to craft shulker boxes.

title: Chorus Plant (block)
summary: Chorus plants are blocks that naturally generate on the outer islands of the End. They can be grown using chorus flowers.

title: Chorus Fruit
summary: Chorus fruit is a food item native to the End that can be eaten, or smelted into popped chorus fruit. It can be eaten even when the hunger bar is full, and eating it may teleport the player up to 8 blocks in any direction.

title: Chest loot
summary: This table summarizes the average quantity of each item that can be found in a naturally-generated chest, depending on its location.

title: Combat Update
summary: The Combat Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.9, a major update released on Monday, February 29, 2016.

title: /give command
summary: Gives an item to one or more players.

title: /fill command
summary: Fills all or parts of a region with a specific block.

title: Dirt Path
summary: Dirt paths are decorative blocks. They are mainly found in villages.

title: Skeleton Horse
summary: A skeleton horse is an undead variant of the horse. It sometimes spawns when lightning strikes.

title: /execute command
summary: /execute executes another command but allows changing the executor, changing the position and angle it is executed at, adding preconditions, and storing its result.

title: Small Fireball
summary: A small fireball is a projectile produced by ranged attack of blazes, and by fire charges when shot from dispensers.

title: Exit portal
summary: The exit portal (also known as the end podium or end fountain) is a feature that enables the player to return to their spawn point, activating upon each defeat of the ender dragon.

title: Mushroom Block
summary: A mushroom block is a solid block that makes up a huge mushroom, which consists of a mushroom stem and brown mushroom blocks or red mushroom blocks, depending on the color of the huge mushroom.

title: Bonus chest
summary: The bonus chest is a feature that appears near the player's spawn if the "Bonus chest" option is toggled on the main menu. It generates with a semi-random collection of basic items to help the player survive early on and gather necessary resources, including tools, blocks, and food.

title: Coral
summary:
Coral is a type of non-solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.
 Dead coral is the dead variants of coral.

title: Instant Damage
summary: Instant Damage is an instant status effect that decreases health for players and living mobs and heals the undead.

title: /clone command
summary: Clones blocks from one region to another.

title: Bountiful Update
summary: The Bountiful Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.8, a major update that was released on Tuesday, September 2, 2014.

title: Armor Stand
summary: Armor stands are entities that are able to hold and display wearable items.

title: Block states
summary: Block states (also known as block properties) are extra pieces of data that further define a block, such as how it appears or behaves.

title: Banner
summary: Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.

title: Rabbit Stew
summary: Rabbit stew is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Raw Mutton
summary: Raw mutton is a food item dropped by sheep when killed.

title: Cooked Mutton
summary: Cooked mutton is a food item obtained from cooking raw mutton.

title: Cooked Rabbit
summary: Cooked rabbit is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Raw Rabbit
summary: Raw rabbit is a food item that can be eaten by the player, or cooked in a furnace or a campfire to make cooked rabbit.

title: Rabbit's Foot
summary: A rabbit's foot is a brewing item obtained from rabbits.

title: Rabbit Hide
summary: Rabbit hide is an item dropped by rabbits.

title: Elder Guardian
summary: An elder guardian is a stronger and larger variant of the guardian. It attacks by firing beams at the player, while retaliating at melee attacks with its spikes and applying Mining Fatigue to all in their monument. It is the largest aquatic mob in Minecraft, as well as the strongest. Three of them spawn inside an ocean monument; one in the top room and one in each wing.

title: Depth Strider
summary: Depth Strider is a boot enchantment that increases underwater movement speed.

title: Prismarine Crystals
summary: Prismarine crystals are items obtained by defeating guardians or elder guardians. They are used along with prismarine shards to craft sea lanterns.

title: Prismarine Shard
summary: A prismarine shard is an item obtained by defeating guardians or elder guardians. It can be used to craft various prismarine blocks as well as sea lanterns.

title: Ocean Monument
summary: Ocean monuments, also known as simply monuments, are rare underwater structures found in deep oceans biome and variants. They are inhabited by guardians and elder guardians. They are the only place where sponges can be found and one of the two places where prismarine can be found; the other being ocean ruins.

title: Guardian
summary: Guardians are pufferfish-like hostile mobs that spawn in and around ocean monuments. They attack by firing beams at the player and retaliate when attacked by a melee attack with their spikes.

title: Sea Lantern
summary: A sea lantern is an underwater light source that appears in ocean monuments and underwater ruins.

title: Rabbit
summary: A rabbit is an uncommon passive mob and is a source of rabbit's foot, rabbit hide and raw rabbit.

title: Prismarine
summary: Prismarine is a type of stone that appears underwater in ruins and ocean monuments.

title: Target selectors
summary: Target selectors are used in commands to select players and entities arbitrarily, without needing to specify an exact player name or a UUID.

title: Jockey
summary: Jockey, by definition, refers to an entity riding another entity.

title: Anvil mechanics
summary: This page explains the mechanics of the anvil.

title: World border
summary: The world border is the current edge of a Minecraft dimension.

title: Endermite
summary: An endermite is the smallest hostile mob. An endermite may spawn when a player throws an ender pearl. They attack by biting the player. Endermen are hostile toward endermites.

title: Falling Block
summary: A falling block is the entity form of a block that appears when a gravity-affected block loses its support.

title: Health Boost
summary: Health Boost is an unused status effect that increases a player's (or mob's) maximum health.

title: Blindness
summary: Blindness is a status effect that impairs the player's vision. It can be cast by illusioners‌ or by consuming suspicious stew.

title: Night Vision
summary: Night Vision is a status effect that enhances the player's ability to see in darkness and underwater.

title: Mining Fatigue
summary: Mining Fatigue is an effect that reduces mining and attack speed, opposite to Haste.

title: Slowness
summary: Slowness is an effect that decreases walking speed.

title: Jump Boost
summary: Jump Boost is a status effect that temporarily increases the jump height of the player.

title: Strength
summary: Strength is an effect which increases attack power.

title: Haste
summary: Haste is a status effect that increases attack speed by 10% per level and increases mining speed by 20% per level. Negative levels decrease mining and attack speed, similar to Mining Fatigue.

title: Weakness
summary: Weakness is a status effect that decreases attack power. It can be cured by a milk bucket or with elixir‌.

title: Spectator
summary: Spectator mode is a game mode that allows the player to fly around and observe the world without interacting with it in any way.

title: Barrier
summary: Barrier is an invisible block used to create solid boundaries.

title: /playsound command
summary: Plays a specified sound at a player, in a location, and in a specific volume and pitch.

title: Regeneration
summary: Regeneration is a status effect that restores a player's (or mob's) health over time.

title: Fire Resistance
summary: Fire Resistance is a status effect that grants the affected player/mob complete immunity to all sources of fire damage.

title: Nausea
summary: Nausea is an effect that warps and wobbles the player's vision similar to a nether portal. The effect does not change its power as its potency changes. It can be obtained only from eating a pufferfish. Drinking milk removes the effect. In Bedrock and Education editions, it can also be cured with tonic.

title: Advancement
summary: Advancements are a way to gradually guide new players into Minecraft and give them challenges to complete, similar to the basic system of achievements in Bedrock Edition.

title: Andesite
summary:
Andesite is a block of igneous rock, most often found in large pockets in the ground.
 Polished andesite is the polished version of andesite.

title: Diorite
summary:
Diorite is a block of igneous rock, found in large pockets in the ground.
 Polished diorite is the polished version of diorite.

title: Slime Block
summary: A slime block is a storage block equivalent to nine slimeballs. It has both sticky and bouncy properties making it useful in conjunction with pistons to move both blocks and entities.

title: Granite
summary:
Granite is a block of igneous rock, found in large pockets in the ground.
 Polished granite is the polished version of granite.

title: Spawn chunk
summary: Spawn chunks are chunks found at the world spawn point which are always loaded in memory, unlike normal chunks which unload when no players are nearby.

title: Absorption
summary: Absorption is a status effect that pads the health bar with extra hearts.

title: Nether Portal (block)
summary: The nether portal block is the translucent part of the nether portal that teleports the player to and from the Nether.

title: Chicken Jockey
summary: Chicken jockeys are the rare appearance of a baby zombie, baby zombified piglin, baby zombie villager, baby husk, or baby drowned riding a chicken.

title: Fireball
summary: A fireball is an explosive projectile expelled from a ghast as its method of attack.

title: Blue Dye
summary: Blue dye is a primary dye color.

title: Music
summary: Minecraft contains many music tracks, which play at various points in game, including the main menu, in Creative mode, in the Nether, in the End, and during the credits.

title: Beetroot Seeds
summary:
Beetroot seeds are items that can be used to plant beetroot crops.
Beetroot crops are planted in farmland and used to grow beetroot and beetroot seeds.

title: Beetroot Soup
summary: Beetroot soup is an unstackable food item.

title: Beetroot
summary: A beetroot is a food and dye ingredient.

title: Minecraft - Volume Beta
summary: Minecraft - Volume Beta is the second Minecraft soundtrack album by C418, the first being Minecraft - Volume Alpha.

title: Dark oak
summary: A dark oak tree is a variant of the oak tree with a thick trunk. They are found in the dark forest biome.

title: Forest rock
summary: A forest rock is a feature found throughout old growth taiga biomes.

title: The Update that Changed the World
summary: The Update that Changed the World is the name for Java Edition version 1.7.2, a major update released on October 25, 2013.

title: /setblock command
summary: Changes a block to another block.

title: Heart of the Sea
summary: A heart of the sea is a rare item that can be crafted into a conduit.

title: Minecart with Command Block
summary: A minecart with command block is an impulse‌ or repeating‌ command block inside a minecart.

title: /tellraw command
summary: Sends a JSON message to players.

title: Shaders
summary: Shaders are used to define the game's rendering of certain elements.

title: Water Breathing
summary: Water breathing is a status effect that prevents or delays drowning, and allows waterlogged beds‌ to be used. It also prevents or delays squid, glow squid, salmon, cod, pufferfish, tropical fish, and tadpoles from taking suffocation damage from being on land.‌

title: Luck of the Sea
summary: Luck of the Sea is an enchantment to a fishing rod that increases luck while fishing.

title: Acacia
summary: The acacia tree is found in the savanna biome. Acacia trees are around 8 blocks tall and feature distinct diagonal trunks, and may occasionally have multiple canopies.

title: Lure
summary: Lure is a fishing rod enchantment that decreases the wait time for a bite on the hook.

title: Dark Forest
summary: A dark forest is a temperate forested biome. It is known for its thick, dense leaf canopies that block light sufficiently to allow hostile mobs to spawn during the daytime.

title: Snowy Taiga
summary: A snowy taiga is a snow-covered biome that comprises a forest of spruce trees, ferns and large ferns, usually generating adjacent to or within snowy plains.

title: Birch Forest
summary: A birch forest is a lush temperate biome, usually generating near other lush biomes. There are two variants in the biome family.

title: Snowy Plains
summary: The snowy plains is a snow-covered grassland biome in the Overworld that usually generates near other snowy biomes.

title: Coarse Dirt
summary: Coarse dirt is a variation of dirt on which grass block cannot spread.

title: Badlands
summary: The badlands, formerly and commonly referred to as the mesa biome, are uncommon warm biomes, featuring mounds of terracotta, coming in various colors. There are three different variants of the badlands biome.

title: /summon command
summary: Summons an entity.

title: Savanna
summary: The savanna is a common warm biome. It typically generates bordering a desert, forest or plains biome, and has three variations total. It is a flat, low-elevation plain with scattered trees. Villages and pillager outposts may generate here.

title: Salmon
summary: Salmon are common passive aquatic mobs found in oceans and rivers. They are a reliable and nutritious source of early-game food when cooked.

title: Amplified
summary: Amplified, stylized in-game as AMPLIFIED, is a world type with a large range of altitude used in Overworld terrain generation.

title: Tropical Fish
summary: Tropical Fish are common passive mobs found in oceans, mangrove swamps and lush caves. There are 2,700 naturally occurring variants. Using commands, up to 3,104 visually distinct variants can be spawned.

title: Pufferfish
summary: Pufferfish are passive mobs found in oceans. They defend themselves by dealing damage and inflicting Poison to nearby players (if not in Peaceful difficulty‌) and certain mobs.

title: Cooked Salmon
summary: Cooked salmon is a food item obtained by cooking raw salmon.

title: Raw Salmon
summary: Raw salmon is a food item that can be eaten by the player or cooked to make cooked salmon.

title: Packed Ice
summary: Packed ice is an opaque solid block variant of ice. Unlike regular ice, it does not melt near bright  light sources.

title: Nether Wastes
summary:
See also: Hell
The Nether wastes is the most common biome found in the Nether.

title: Jumping
summary: Jumping is a mechanic that elevates the player 1 1⁄4 block into the air. It also has other effects when combined with another forms of movement.

title: Game rule
summary: Game rules are a set of customizable options for a specific in-game world.

title: Horse Update
summary: The Horse Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.6.1 (or 1.6), a major update released on July 1, 2013.

title: Xbox One Edition
summary: Minecraft: Xbox One Edition is the Legacy Console Edition version of Minecraft developed by 4J Studios and Mojang Studios for the Xbox One.

title: Attribute
summary: Attributes are a system of buffs/debuffs that are properties on mobs and players. Attributes also have modifiers that adjust the strength of their effect.

title: Enchanted Golden Apple
summary: An enchanted golden apple (in Java Edition) or enchanted apple (in Bedrock Edition), is a rare, uncraftable variant of the golden apple that grants much more powerful effects when consumed.

title: Sand
summary:
Sand is a gravity-affected block found abundantly in deserts and beaches, and less commonly in or near surface water.
 Red sand is a variation of sand found exclusively in the badlands.

title: Cake
summary:
Cake is a food and a block that can be eaten by the player.
A cake with candle is a light-producing variation created when a candle is used on an uneaten cake.

title: Block of Coal
summary: A block of coal is a storage block, equivalent to nine coal, that can also be used as fuel.

title: Terracotta
summary: Terracotta is a block that comes in the sixteen dye colors (except with a brownish tint), as well as an undyed variant. It is found abundantly in badlands biomes, or can be obtained by smelting clay.

title: Name Tag
summary: A name tag is an item used to name mobs in the world and prevent them from despawning naturally.

title: Zombie Horse
summary: A zombie horse is an unused variant of the regular horse.

title: Taming
summary: Taming is a game mechanic that allows the player to domesticate and tame a wild mob.

title: Horse Saddle
summary: Horse saddles were items which allowed the player to ride horses.

title: Lead
summary: Leads are tools used to leash and lead passive and neutral animals, golems and some monsters.

title: Horse Armor
summary: Horse armor is a special type of armor that can be given to a horse to wear.

title: Carpet
summary: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

title: Horse
summary: Horses are passive mobs that can be ridden when tamed and saddled.

title: Realms
summary: Minecraft Realms is an official subscription-based server hosting service that allows players to create and manage their own private Minecraft servers. Hosted by Mojang, Realms provides a simple way to create servers and allows the owner to manage them from inside the game, without knowledge of hosting on the internet. In Java Edition, Realms also allow players to choose from a list of minigames to play temporarily, as well as several pre-made world templates, adventure maps, experience maps, and inspiration maps, all made by Realms community map makers.
