Maps on Java Edition are updated by Mojang sporadically, ranging from a few days to as recently as one to two months. Realms are not intended for large public servers, but for groups of friends or as a family server.

title: /help command
summary: Provides help/lists of commands.

title: Hay Bale
summary: Hay bales are storage blocks equivalent to nine pieces of wheat. They are used as a crafting ingredient, to feed llamas, horses and horse variants, reduce fall damage or extend campfire smoke.

title: Stonecutter
summary: The stonecutter is used to craft stone and copper related blocks in smaller and more precise quantities than crafting, and is more efficient than crafting for certain recipes. It also serves as a stone mason's job site block.

title: Scoreboard
summary: The scoreboard system is a complex gameplay mechanic utilized through commands. Mainly intended for mapmakers and server operators, scoreboards are used to track, set, and list the scores of entities in a myriad of different ways.

title: Weapon
summary: Weapons are items that can be used to damage entities.

title: Dropper
summary: A dropper is a low-capacity storage block that can eject its contents into the world or into other containers when given a redstone signal.

title: /testfor command
summary: Counts entities (players, mobs, items, etc.) matching specified conditions.

title: Minecart with Hopper
summary: A minecart with hopper is a hopper inside a minecart. Unlike a normal hopper it pulls items from containers much more quickly, cannot push items into containers and can collect item entities through a single layer of solid blocks.

title: Activator Rail
summary: An activator rail is a type of rail that can "activate" certain minecarts.

title: Block of Quartz
summary: A block of quartz is a mineral block used for decoration. It can be turned into a chiseled quartz block, quartz pillar or quartz bricks.

title: Minecart with Monster Spawner
summary: Minecarts with monster spawners are a combination of both minecarts and monster spawner.

title: Minecart with TNT
summary: A minecart with TNT is a block of TNT inside a minecart. Unlike normal TNT it can detonate instantly under certain conditions and its damage and blast radius is increased by its speed when it detonates.

title: Easter eggs
summary: An Easter egg is an intentional hidden message, inside joke, or feature in a work such as a computer program, web page, video game, television program, movie, book, or crossword. Minecraft features several Easter eggs hidden in the game.

title: Daylight Detector
summary:
A daylight detector is a block that outputs a redstone signal based on sunlight.
Using it inverts it, causing it instead to output a redstone signal based on the darkness of the sky.

title: Hopper
summary: A hopper is a low-capacity storage block that can be used to collect item entities directly above it, as well as to transfer items into and out of other containers.

title: Trapped Chest
summary: A trapped chest functions as a normal chest for item storage, but it produces redstone power when opened. It can be visually distinguished from normal chests by a red coloration around the latch.

title: Nether Quartz
summary: Nether quartz is a white mineral found in the Nether.

title: Nether Quartz Ore
summary: Nether quartz ore is ore found in the Nether, and is a source of quartz.

title: Block of Redstone
summary: A block of redstone is a mineral block equivalent to nine redstone dust. It acts as a permanently powered redstone power source that can be pushed by pistons.

title: Emerald
summary: Emeralds are rare minerals that are used primarily as the currency for trading with villagers and wandering traders. Naturally-occurring emeralds are rarer than diamonds.

title: Apple
summary: Apples are food items that can be eaten by the player.

title: Thorns
summary: Thorns is an armor enchantment that causes attackers to be damaged when they deal damage to the wearer.

title: Firework Star
summary: Firework stars are items used to determine the color, effect, and shape of firework rockets.

title: Enchanted Book
summary: An enchanted book is an item that lets players add enchantments to certain items using an anvil.

title: Firework Rocket
summary: A firework rocket is an item (and entity) used for creating decorative explosions, boosting when flying with elytra, and loading into a crossbow as ammunition.

title: Dimension
summary: Dimensions are accessible realms within a Minecraft world characterized by a way of generation, biomes and structures, and other things unique to one dimension.

title: Redstone Comparator
summary: A redstone comparator is a redstone component used to maintain, compare, or subtract signal strength, or to measure certain block states (primarily the fullness of containers).

title: Redstone Update
summary: The Redstone Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.5, a major update released on Wednesday, March 13, 2013.

title: Nether Reactor Core
summary: The nether reactor core is an unused block that cannot be obtained with the use of commands.

title: Invisibility
summary: Invisibility is a status effect that turns entities invisible. It has one potency level (active), but its duration can be extended.

title: Anvil
summary: An anvil is a block that allows players to repair items, rename items, and combine enchantments.

title: Instant mining
summary: Instant mining is a game mechanic in which 1 block can be broken per game tick without the delay of 3⁄10 of a second (6 ticks). Below are listed the tool tier and the Efficiency and Haste levels necessary to instant-mine a block.

title: Glazed Terracotta
summary: Glazed terracotta is a vibrant solid block that comes in the 16 regular dye colors, obtained by smelting colored terracotta.

title: Podzol
summary: Podzol is a dirt-type block that naturally blankets the surface of the old growth taiga and bamboo jungles, along with their respective variants. Grass blocks and mycelium cannot spread to this block.

title: Lava lake
summary: A lava lake is a small, widespread, naturally-generated feature in the Overworld that contains a volume of lava.

title: /stopsound command
summary: Stops a given sound.

title: Mushroom Fields
summary: Mushroom fields, commonly referred to as mushroom islands, are rare biomes which always generate as islands surrounded by deep oceans. They are the only place in the game where mycelium and mooshrooms are found, and have the special property that no hostile mobs normally spawn in these biomes.

title: Witch Hut
summary: Swamp huts (also known as witch huts) are small generated structures that have the ability to spawn witches and black cats.

title: Teleportation
summary: Teleportation is a form of transportation in which the moving object is instantaneously moved to its target location.

title: Bat
summary: A bat is a flying ambient passive mob that spawns in dark areas underground.

title: Resource pack
summary: The resource pack system provides a way for players to customize textures, models, music, sounds, languages, texts such as the end poem, splashes, credits, and fonts without any code modification.

title: Witch
summary: A witch is a hostile mob that uses harmful splash potions as ranged weapons and positive potions on itself.

title: Carrot
summary:
A carrot is a food item obtained from carrot crops that can be used to plant them, eaten or used as a crafting ingredient.
Carrot crops are planted in farmland and used to grow carrots.

title: Pumpkin Pie
summary: Pumpkin pie is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Punch
summary: Punch is an enchantment for a bow that increases an arrow's knockback, much like the Knockback enchantment for melee weapons. This does not increase the damage of the bow.

title: Infinity
summary: Infinity is an enchantment to bows that prevents regular arrows from being consumed when shot. One arrow is needed to use a bow enchanted with Infinity.

title: Flame
summary: Flame is an enchantment that causes bows to shoot flaming arrows.

title: Power
summary: Power is a bow enchantment which increases arrow damage.

title: Wither Skeleton
summary: Wither skeletons are tall black variants of skeletons equipped with stone swords that inflict the poison-like Wither effect. They are found exclusively in nether fortresses and are the only source of wither skeleton skulls.

title: Nether Star
summary: The nether star is a rare item dropped by the wither that is used solely to craft beacons.

title: Pretty Scary Update
summary: The Pretty Scary Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.4.2, a major update officially released on Thursday, October 25, 2012.

title: Carrot on a Stick
summary: A carrot on a stick is an item that can be used to control saddled pigs.

title: Head
summary: A head is a block. There are six‌/seven‌ types of heads: player (Steve's head by default), zombie, skeleton, wither skeleton, creeper, piglin‌, and dragon.

title: Dragon Egg
summary: The dragon egg is a decorative block or a "trophy item", and is the rarest item obtainable in the game, as it generates once (or twice in Bedrock Edition).

title: Potato
summary:
A potato is a food item obtained from potato crops that can be used to plant them, consumed raw or cooked to make baked potatoes.
Potato crops are planted in farmland and used to grow potatoes and, rarely, poisonous potatoes.

title: Poisonous Potato
summary: A poisonous potato is a type of potato that can poison the player.

title: Golden Carrot
summary: A golden carrot is a valuable food item and brewing ingredient. It provides the second most saturation in the game, behind suspicious stew crafted with either a dandelion or blue orchid.

title: Baked Potato
summary: A baked potato is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Wither
summary: The wither is a player-constructed undead hostile boss mob that floats and shoots explosive skulls at players and mobs. It is the only source of nether stars, which are used to craft beacons.

title: Lectern
summary: A lectern is a block used to hold written books for multiple players to read in multiplayer. It also serves as a librarian's job site block.

title: Wall
summary: A wall is a decorative block. Like fences, they can be used to create boundaries, because players and most mobs cannot climb or jump over them.

title: Flower Pot
summary: A flower pot is a decorative block that can contain flowers, bamboo, saplings, cacti, mushrooms, fungi, and other reasonably small plants.

title: Item Frame
summary:
An item frame is an entity‌ or block entity‌ that displays the item or block that is inside it.
A glow item frame keeps itself and the item inside it illuminated, even in the dark.

title: Zombie Villager
summary: A zombie villager is a variant of the zombie that can be cured into a normal villager using a golden apple while it is under the effect of Weakness.

title: Command Block
summary: A command block is a block that can execute commands.

title: Beacon
summary: A beacon is a block that projects a light beam skyward and can provide status effects such as Speed, Jump Boost, Haste, Regeneration, Resistance, or Strength to nearby players.

title: Minecraft Infdev
summary: Minecraft Infdev refers to all 26 versions of Infdev, released from February 27, 2010, to June 30, 2010, as well as one version of Alpha released on June 30, 2010.

title: Obsidian platform
summary: The obsidian platform is a 5×1×5 square of obsidian that generates when an entity enters the End through an end portal.

title: Jungle pyramid
summary: Jungle pyramids‌ or jungle temples‌ are structures found in jungles.

title: String
summary: String is an item used in crafting recipes such as bows, fishing rods and leads. When placed as a block, string becomes tripwire, which can be combined with tripwire hooks to form a tripwire circuit.

title: Tripwire Hook
summary: A tripwire hook is a block that can be used to detect entities (players, mobs, items, etc.) when part of a tripwire circuit is passed through.

title: Block of Emerald
summary: A block of emerald is a precious mineral block equivalent to nine emeralds.

title: Enchanting mechanics
summary: This article is about the mechanics of enchanting.

title: Desert pyramid
summary: A desert pyramid, often referred to as a desert temple, is a sandstone structure that generates in deserts. It contains 4 chests under the floor in the center protected by a TNT trap.

title: Emerald Ore
summary: Emerald ore is a rare mineral block that generates only in mountains, frozen peaks and windswept hills biomes.

title: Ender Chest
summary: Ender chests are a type of chest whose contents are exclusive to each player, and can be accessed from anywhere in the world.

title: Demo mode
summary: The demo mode is a demo version of Minecraft for users who have not purchased the game yet and would like to try it out first without purchasing it.

title: Trading
summary: The trading system is a gameplay mechanic that allows players to trade principally emeralds for items (and vice-versa) with villagers, as well as wandering traders.

title: Speed
summary: Speed is a status effect that increases an entity's walking speed by 20% multiplied by the effect level.  It expands a player's field of view (FOV) accordingly.  Negative levels decrease speed.

title: Splitscreen
summary: Splitscreen is a console-exclusive feature that allows up to four players to play on one screen at the same time.

title: The Void
summary: The Void is an empty biome that generates only a 33×33 void start platform centered on a block of cobblestone at coordinates 8, 3, 8.

title: Written Book
summary: A written book is an item created after a book and quill is signed. It appears the same as a regular book, but without the quill, and has an enchanted-looking glint.

title: Book and Quill
summary: A book and quill is an item used to write written books.

title: World selection menu
summary: The world selection menu is one of the game's multiple menu screens, which allows access to the Create New World menu, and equally importantly listing preexisting worlds which can be entered.

title: Chain
summary: Chains are metallic decoration blocks.

title: Main menu
summary: The main menu is one of Minecraft's several menu screens.

title: Boat
summary: A boat is a drivable vehicle entity used primarily for fast transport of players and passenger mobs over bodies of water. Bamboo rafts‌ look different, but function nearly identically to other boats.

title: Healing
summary: Healing is the mechanic of regaining lost health.

title: Flying
summary: Flying is the most versatile form of transportation and is available in Creative and Spectator mode.

title: Dispenser
summary: A dispenser is a low-capacity storage block that can fire projectiles, use certain items or tools or place certain blocks, fluids or entities when given a redstone signal. Items that do not have unique dispenser functions are instead ejected into the world.

title: LEGO Minecraft
summary: LEGO Minecraft is a licensed LEGO theme of sets based on Minecraft.

title: Obsidian Pillar
summary: End spikes, also known as obsidian spikes, obsidian pillars, obsidian towers, and end pillars are a feature in The End biome that are made of obsidian.

title: Drops
summary: Drops are items that appear when mobs and some other entities die or when most kinds of blocks are broken.

title: Plains
summary: Plains are temperate grasslands biomes. They are among the first biomes added to the game. There are two plains biome variants in the biome family. They are the second most common biome, with Forest being slightly more common.

title: Tundra
summary: A tundra was a snow-covered biome and the precursor of the current snowy plains, but with fewer trees and no tall grass, tundras existed in the game prior to the Adventure Update (Beta 1.8 for Java Edition) or in versions before Alpha 0.9.0 for  Pocket Edition.

title: Forest
summary: Forests are temperate biomes. There are a total of two variants in the biome family. They are the most common biome in Minecraft, being only slightly more common than plains.

title: Beach
summary: Beaches are common coastal biomes that serve as transition biomes from the mainland to an ocean. There are three variants of beach biome.

title: Iron Golem
summary: An iron golem is a large, powerful neutral utility mob that defends players and villagers. It is one of the few mobs that can be built then spawned in the game.

title: Item (entity)
summary: Items are "dropped" blocks or items (non-block resources) that appear in the world, rather than being in the inventory of a player or block entity; they are a type of entity.

title: Saturation
summary: Saturation is an instant status effect that reduces the need for eating. It also prevents death by hunger if the player has no food.

title: Desert Well
summary: Desert wells are features consisting of sandstone.

title: Fire Charge
summary: Fire charges are items that can be used as a single-use version of a flint and steel or shot as a small fireball from a dispenser.

title: Bottle o' Enchanting
summary: A bottle o' enchanting is a throwable item that releases experience orbs on impact.

title: Ocelot
summary: Ocelots are rare passive mobs found in jungles.

title: Jungle tree
summary: Jungle trees are generated structures native to the jungle biome. Jungle trees range from short bushes to tall trees that reach up to 31 blocks in height. Their wood is of a pale brownish color.

title: Jungle
summary: A jungle is a temperate biome full of dense vegetation which generate in areas with high humidity values, often next to forests. There are three varieties of jungles.

title: Spruce
summary: A spruce and pine, grows from a spruce sapling and has growth patterns and requirements similar to birch trees, although they appear different. They are mainly found in the taiga biome, but they may also generate in windswept forest, snowy plains, snowy taiga, and old growth taiga biomes.

title: Oak
summary: An oak is the most common tree in the game, found in a variety of biomes, available in several variants. It has the smallest initial space requirement for growth, and along with dark oak trees, it has a chance to drop an apple when a leaf block is destroyed. As with birches, an oak tree grown near flowers can generate with a bee nest attached.

title: World type
summary: World type is an option to change how worlds generate in Minecraft.

title: Superflat
summary: Superflat JE or Flat BE is a world type or a vanilla world preset replacing the normal varied terrain of the Overworld, with customizable layers.

title: Water
summary: Water is a fluid that naturally generates abundantly in the Overworld.

title: Language
summary: Languages is a feature that allows changing languages for people who prefer to play in a language other than their default setting. The language menu is accessible via a button in the options/settings menu below general.

title: Spawn Egg
summary: A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.

title: Particles
summary: Particles are special graphical effects in Minecraft that are created when certain events occur, such as explosions, rainfall, or smelting items in a furnace.

title: Textures
summary: Textures in Minecraft are images applied to blocks, items, entities, particles, weather effects and GUI that allow players to recognize it. In Java Edition default textures are located in assets\minecraft\textures in client.jar, while in Bedrock and Education editions they are in data\vanilla and data\vanilla_<game version>.

title: Fortune
summary: Fortune is an enchantment applied to mining and digging tools that increases the number and/or chances of specific item drops. It does not increase experience drops.

title: Unbreaking
summary: Unbreaking is an enchantment that gives a chance for an item to avoid durability reduction when it is used, effectively increasing the item's durability.

title: Efficiency
summary: Efficiency is an enchantment that increases the player's mining speed.

title: Silk Touch
summary: Silk Touch is a tool enchantment that causes certain blocks to drop themselves as items instead of their usual drops when mined.

title: Looting
summary: Looting is an enchantment for swords that can cause mobs to drop more items and increase the chances of rare drops. The additional drops do not affect experience.

title: Fire Aspect
summary: Fire Aspect is a sword enchantment that sets the target on fire.

title: Knockback
summary: Knockback is an enchantment to a sword that increases the sword's knockback.

title: Bane of Arthropods
summary: Bane of Arthropods is a weapon enchantment that increases damage to arthropod mobs (spiders, cave spiders, bees, silverfish, and endermites).

title: Respiration
summary: Respiration is a helmet enchantment for extending breathing time underwater. It can be applied to other armor pieces using commands.

title: Smite
summary: Smite is an enchantment applied to a sword or axe, increasing the damage dealt to undead mobs.

title: Sharpness
summary: Sharpness is an enchantment applied to a sword or axe that increases melee damage.

title: Aqua Affinity
summary: Aqua Affinity is a helmet enchantment that increases underwater mining speed.

title: Feather Falling
summary: Feather Falling is an enchantment unique to boots that reduces fall damage the user takes.  It does not affect falling speed.

title: Blast Protection
summary: Blast Protection is an armor enchantment that reduces damage taken from explosions and fireworks.

title: Projectile Protection
summary: Projectile Protection is an armor enchantment that reduces damage taken from projectiles.

title: Protection
summary: Protection is an enchantment applied to armor that adds bonus damage reduction.

title: Fire Protection
summary: Fire Protection is an armor enchantment that reduces damage taken from sources of fire.

title: End Poem
summary: The End Poem is a freehand poem written by musician Julian Gough that appears when the player uses the exit portal, before the credits. It has been in the public domain, under the CC0 1.0 Universal (CC0 1.0) Public Domain Dedication, since 2022.

title: End Crystal
summary: An end crystal is an entity that can be crafted or found on the End's main island, where it heals the ender dragon. It can only be placed on obsidian or bedrock and explodes instantly when attacked or damaged in most ways.

title: Nether Brick
summary: A nether brick is an item made by smelting netherrack in a furnace.

title: Third-person view
summary: Third person view allows the player to view the nearby environment from an "outside" perspective.

title: Death messages
summary: Death messages are messages sent in the chat to either all players or a specific player to announce the death of a player or pet.

title: Instant Health
summary: Instant Health is an instant status effect that increases health for living mobs and damages the undead.

title: Ocean
summary: The ocean is an aquatic biome consisting of water. Oceans are the largest biome by area, covering anywhere around 25-33% of the surface area of the Overworld when factoring in all of its varieties and consist of a deep water source with the surface at an altitude of y=63 by default, which is counted as the "sea level" layer of the world.

title: Splash Potion
summary: Splash potions are a variant of potions that can be thrown.

title: Glistering Melon Slice
summary: A glistering melon slice is an inedible item used for brewing potions of Healing. It is also one of the many potion ingredients that can be used to make mundane potions.

title: Brewing
summary: Brewing is the process of creating potions, splash potions, and lingering potions by adding various ingredients to water bottles in a brewing stand. In Education Edition, brewing can also create medicines.

title: Far Lands
summary: The Far Lands is a terrain generation bug that appears when the noise generators responsible for creating the shape of terrain stop functioning properly.

title: Bedrock Edition
summary: Minecraft: Bedrock Edition (officially just Minecraft) refers to the multi-platform versions of Minecraft developed by Mojang Studios, Xbox Game Studios, and SkyBox Labs and based on the Bedrock codebase.

title: End Stone
summary: End stone is a block that appears in the End and, apart from generated structures, makes up all of the solid ground that exists in that dimension.

title: The End
summary: The End is a dark, space-like dimension consisting of separate islands in the void made out of end stone. It is inhabited by endermen and shulkers. The ender dragon also spawns when the player first arrives.

title: Enchanting
summary: Enchanting is a mechanic that augments armor, tools, weapons, and books with one or more of a variety of "enchantments" that improve an item's existing abilities or imbue them with additional abilities and uses. A special "glint" animation appears on items that are enchanted.

title: End portal
summary: An end portal is a naturally occurring generated structure that is used to travel into the End. It can only be found in the portal room of a stronghold.

title: End Portal Frame
summary: An end portal frame is a block that resembles end stone with a decorative bluish-green top, with sides decorated in hollow rounded rectangles with the same color as the top.

title: Eye of Ender
summary: An eye of ender is a craftable item used to locate strongholds and activate the end portals within them.

title: Enchanting Table
summary: An enchanting table is a block that allows players to spend their experience point levels to enchant tools, weapons, books, armor, and certain other items.

title: Brewing Stand
summary: A brewing stand is a block used for brewing potions using bottles and suitable ingredients. It also serves as a cleric's job site block.

title: Cauldron
summary: A cauldron is a block that can contain water, lava or powder snow and, in certain situations, collect it from the environment. In Bedrock Edition, it can also hold potions or dyed water. It also serves as a leatherworker's job site block.

title: Item repair
summary: Item repair is a feature that allows players to repair damaged tools, armor, or other items with durability by combining them in the crafting grid or a grindstone.

title: Infested Block
summary: Infested blocks are blocks disguised as stone, cobblestone, deepslate, or any stone bricks variants, but spawn silverfish when broken in Survival or Adventure mode.

title: Fermented Spider Eye
summary: A fermented spider eye is a brewing ingredient.

title: Magma Cream
summary: Magma cream is an item used in brewing to create potions of Fire Resistance, and to manually craft magma blocks.

title: Glass Bottle
summary: A glass bottle is an item that can hold water, potions, honey, or dragon's breath.

title: Blaze Powder
summary: Blaze powder is an item made from a blaze rod, which is dropped by a blaze when killed. Its main uses are to fuel brewing stands, to brew strength potions, and to make eyes of ender to take the player to the End.

title: Spider Eye
summary: A spider eye is a poisonous food and brewing item.

title: Breeding
summary: Breeding is a game mechanic that allows mobs of the same species to breed with each other to produce offspring (with the exception of breeding a mule, which requires a horse and donkey).

title: Hardcore
summary: Hardcore is a Java Edition exclusive variant of Survival and one of the main game modes in Minecraft. In this mode, the world is locked to Hard difficulty and the player cannot respawn after dying.

title: Mycelium
summary: Mycelium is a particularly rare variant of dirt that is found naturally only in mushroom fields biomes. It has a particle effect that resembles tiny spores being released constantly from the surface.

title: Lily Pad
summary: A lily pad is a short, flat non-solid block that can be found naturally growing only on water, in swamps and wheat farm rooms in woodland mansions.

title: Magma Cube
summary: A magma cube is a hostile mob found in the Nether. A magma cube behaves similarly to a slime, but is fireproof, jumps higher and deals more damage.

title: Villager
summary: Villagers are passive mobs that inhabit villages, work at their professions, breed, and interact with each other. Their outfit varies according to their occupation and biome. A player can trade with them using emeralds as currency.

title: Blaze
summary: Blazes are floating hostile mobs found in nether fortresses, and are the only source of blaze rods. They will attack through an occasional fireball trio attack.

title: Gold Nugget
summary: Gold nuggets are items used to make gold ingots and other various golden items. One gold nugget is effectively worth one-ninth of a gold ingot.

title: Nether Wart
summary:
Nether wart is a fungus harvested from nether wart crops and is used to plant them, as well as being vital in the creation of potions.
Nether wart crops are found in nether fortresses and bastions and is used to grow nether wart in soul sand.

title: Blaze Rod
summary: Blaze rods are items exclusively obtained from blazes. They act as an essential ingredient in brewing, as a fuel for both brewing and smelting, and for crafting the eye of ender that leads the player to the End.

title: Ghast Tear
summary: Ghast tears are items dropped by ghasts. They can be used to make potions of Regeneration and end crystals.

title: Snow Golem
summary: A snow golem is a player-constructed passive utility mob that is affected by temperature and whose utilities include defense against monsters and, in some biomes, snow farming.

title: Nether Fortress
summary: A nether fortress is a large structure found in the Nether, consisting of bridges, corridors and towers. Nether fortressess are the only place where wither skeletons and blazes spawn, the latter of which's blaze rods being required to craft and fuel brewing stands and craft eyes of ender to access the End. It also features nether wart as loot, which is a key ingredient in brewing.

title: Farming
summary: Farming refers to the systematic production of renewable resources. The technique is typically used to get blocks, food, experience and other desired items. Specific types of farming are listed below.

title: Mooshroom
summary: Mooshrooms are mushroom-covered variants of cows exclusive to the rare mushroom fields biome.

title: Nether Bricks
summary:
Nether bricks  are blocks used to form nether fortresses in the Nether.
Red nether bricks, cracked nether bricks and chiseled nether bricks are decorative variants that do not naturally generate.

title: Poison
summary: Poison is an effect that inflicts damage over time, reducing the player's health to 1 (), but cannot kill.

title: Effect
summary: An effect is a helpful or harmful condition that affects an entity.

title: Hunger (effect)
summary: Hunger is a status effect which causes the hunger bar to deplete faster than normal.

title: Terrain features
summary: This page lists generated terrain features that are created in a Minecraft world.

title: Sprinting
summary: Sprinting is a method of transportation that allows the player to move faster, at the expense of depleting saturation. While sprinting, the player's field of view expands slightly while increasing the player's reach by .5-1 block. Players also inflict more knockback on the first hit when sprinting.

title: Blocking
summary: Blocking is a gameplay mechanic that allows players to block several forms of damage.

title: Ender Pearl
summary: An ender pearl is an item that can be thrown to teleport to where it lands, or used to craft eyes of ender which are required to access the End.

title: Swamp
summary: A swamp is a temperate biome where swamp huts containing witches and black cats generate, slimes and frogs can spawn. The main biome is forested with oak trees covered with vines, dead bushes, mushrooms and blue orchids.

title: Wheat Seeds
summary:
Wheat seeds (in Java Edition) or seeds (in Bedrock Edition) are items obtained by breaking grass, or more abundantly harvested from wheat crops, and are used to plant them.
Wheat crops are planted in farmland and used to grow wheat and wheat seeds.

title: Furnace
summary: A furnace is a utility block used for the smelting of blocks and items.

title: Cave Spider
summary: Cave spiders are small variants of the spider that inflict Poison with their attacks. They are exclusively spawned by monster spawners found in mineshafts.

title: Pumpkin Seeds
summary:
Pumpkin seeds are items obtained from pumpkins that can be used to grow pumpkin stems.
Pumpkin stems are plants grown on farmland that, over time, grow pumpkins on dirt, mud and moss blocks adjacent to them.

title: Melon Seeds
summary:
Melon seeds are items obtained from melon slices that can be used to grow melon stems.
Melon stems are plants grown on farmland that, over time, grow melons on dirt, mud and moss blocks adjacent to them.

title: Melon Slice
summary: A melon slice is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Mineshaft
summary: Mineshafts are generated structures found primarily in caves.

title: Vines
summary: Vines are climbable non-solid vegetation blocks that grow on walls.

title: Rotten Flesh
summary: Rotten flesh is a food item that can be eaten by the player, at the high risk of inflicting Hunger.

title: Experience
summary: Experience (EXP or XP for short) can be obtained by gathering experience orbs from mining, defeating mobs, breeding, trading, fishing, completing advancements,‌ and using grindstones and furnaces. Experience gained during a player's life affects the player's score on the death screen. While having no direct effect on the player character, it can be used to enhance their equipment through enchanting, or by using an anvil to repair, rename, or combine enchantments on equipment. Experience also recovers durability on items with Mending that are being worn or are in-hand.

title: River
summary: A river is a common biome. Rivers can serve as borders between various other biomes, and usually lead to oceans, although they can also form loops.

title: Raw Beef
summary: Raw beef is a food item that can be eaten by the player or cooked in a furnace, smoker, or campfire to make steak.

title: Mountains
summary: Mountains refer to six somewhat rare cold, snowy, and temperate biomes.

title: Nautilus Shell
summary: A nautilus shell is an item that is used for crafting conduits.

title: Enderman
summary: An enderman is a tall neutral mob found in all three dimensions. Endermen normally ignore players but run to attack those that damage it or look directly at its face. Endermen teleport to avoid water (which harms them), sunlight, projectiles and some other damage sources, and they occasionally pick up certain blocks.

title: Steak
summary: Steak (in Java Edition) or cooked beef (in Bedrock Edition) is a food item obtained from cows, mooshrooms, or from cooking raw beef.

title: Glass Pane
summary: A glass pane is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to glass blocks.

title: Raw Chicken
summary: Raw chicken is a food item that can be eaten by the player. It can be cooked in a furnace, smoker, or a campfire to make cooked chicken.

title: Cooked Chicken
summary: Cooked chicken is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Adventure Update
summary:
The Adventure Update was a major update to Java Edition focused on fighting, exploration, and adventuring, as well as other aspects. Its content was implemented in Beta 1.8 and 1.0.0. 
It was announced on June 10, 2011 by Notch and  was initially planned to be implemented in Java Edition Beta 1.7. An early version of the Adventure Update was playable by fans at Mojang's booth at PAX Prime 2011, which was held between August 26 and 28. Because of the size of the content, the first part of the update was pushed back to Beta 1.8, which became available on September 14, 2011 and the rest of the update being part of Minecraft 1.0, which was released on November 18, 2011. The pre-releases of Minecraft Beta 1.8 and Beta 1.9 were leaked before their official releases, and Notch approved these leaks on his Twitter.

title: Melon
summary: A melon is a fruit block that grows from a fully-grown melon stem, which in turn is grown from melon seeds.

title: Taiga
summary: The taiga is a cold biome which comprises a grassland forested with ferns and spruce trees.

title: Stronghold
summary: A stronghold is a structure that occurs naturally underground in the Overworld, and is the only place where a player can find an end portal. Strongholds can be located by using an eye of ender.

title: Options
summary: Minecraft's user environment can be configured through the Options setting. A few additional options can be changed only by editing the options.txt file manually.

title: Fog
summary: Fog is a rendering feature intended for obscuring the player's view distance, usually for atmospheric effect or for seamlessly occluding sharp boundaries such as unloaded chunks. While traditionally referring to render distance, there are many other types of fog that can be encountered in-game under specific circumstances.

title: Giant
summary: Giants are unused, over-sized mobs that look like zombies.

title: Herobrine
summary: Herobrine is the subject of a community-made creepypasta.

title: Ocean Ruins
summary: Ocean ruins or underwater ruins are oceanic structures primarily composed of stone bricks or sandstone. They come in many different sizes varying from large villages to single ruined huts. They are rare, and have cold and warm variants.

title: Stone Bricks
summary:
Stone bricks and the variants  cracked stone bricks,  mossy stone bricks, and  chiseled stone bricks are materials found in structures such as strongholds, igloo basements, jungle temples, ocean ruins and ruined portals.
 Smooth stone bricks are a fifth variant exclusive to Bedrock Edition, visually identical to regular stone bricks, which cannot be found naturally and are only accessible via commands.

title: Village
summary: A village is a group or complex of buildings and other structures that generate naturally in the Overworld. A village is inhabited by villagers, as people, cats, as pets, iron golems, for defense, passive livestock mobs, for farms, occasional zombie villagers, and wandering traders with their trader llamas. A village is a source of resources to the player, obtained from trading, loot chests, and other materials found in the village. Villages are also a target of raid attacks by illagers when a player walks into a village with the Bad Omen effect.

title: Coordinates
summary: Coordinates numerically represent a location in a dimension.

title: Silverfish
summary: Silverfish are small hostile mobs found hiding in stone-like blocks in mountains, strongholds, igloo basements and woodland mansions. They crawl at their targets to bite them, and attacking them will incite other nearby silverfish to emerge from their blocks and attack the aggressor.

title: Canyon
summary: A canyon (commonly referred to as ravine) is a deep, long crack generating in the Overworld that can connect with caves. They often appear deep underground but can breach the surface.

title: Huge mushroom
summary: Huge mushrooms are tree-like features that consist of mushroom blocks. They can be found naturally in swamp‌, Flower Forest‌, dark forest, and mushroom fields biomes, or grown from a small mushroom by applying bone meal on it - small mushrooms do not turn into huge mushrooms naturally.

title: Farm
summary: A farm is a generated structure in a village used for growing various crops.

title: Xbox 360 Edition
summary: Minecraft: Xbox 360 Edition is the Xbox 360 version of Minecraft, developed by 4J Studios in conjunction with Mojang Studios and Xbox Game Studios.

title: Shears
summary: Shears are tools required to obtain some organic blocks or otherwise mine them faster as well as to shear certain entities and blocks.

title: Player
summary: The player is the main controlled character in Minecraft. The nine default player skins are known as Steve, Alex, Noor, Sunny, Ari, Zuri, Makena, Kai, and Efe with all unchanged skins being split between these nine skins.

title: Generated structures
summary: This page lists structures (aka. generated structures, structure features) in Minecraft. A structure is defined as what is disabled when the "Generate structures" world creation option is turned off. Features, such as dungeons and desert wells, do still generate with this option turned off; however, they are listed on this page in #Structure-like Features due to them having the appearance of an artificial structure as opposed to a natural formation.

title: Dead Bush
summary: Dead bushes are transparent blocks in the form of an aesthetic plant.

title: Pocket Edition
summary: Minecraft: Pocket Edition (informally known as MCPE or PE) was the former title of the Bedrock Edition of Minecraft developed by Mojang Studios for mobile devices before 1.2.0, although subsequent builds are still commonly (if erroneously) referred to as Pocket Edition.

title: Grass
summary: Grass is a non-solid plant block that has wheat seeds as a drop.

title: Trapdoor
summary: A trapdoor is a solid, transparent block that can be used as an openable 1×1 barrier.

title: Crash
summary: Crashes are unexpected shutdowns of Minecraft, generally caused by unhandled "exceptions" while running the game.

title: Subtitles
summary: Subtitles (also known as captions) are a feature which display text for sounds in-game. This feature is mainly intended for players who have hearing impairments, are deaf, or play with sounds off. They can also be used for hearing quieter sounds, locating sounds, or identifying sounds a player doesn't recognize.

title: Map
summary: A map is an item used to view explored terrain and mark landmarks.

title: Cobweb
summary: A cobweb is a block that slows down entity movements.

title: Detector Rail
summary: A detector rail is a block that can transport minecarts and can be used as a switchable redstone power source.

title: Powered Rail
summary: A powered rail is a type of rail that is used to increase or decrease the velocity of moving minecarts.

title: Thunderstorm
summary: A thunderstorm is a somewhat uncommon and dangerous weather condition.

title: Snowfall
summary: Snowfall is a type of weather that occurs occasionally in Minecraft.

title: Piston
summary:
A piston is a block capable of pushing blocks, players, and mobs when given a redstone pulse.
A sticky piston has the same function as a piston but can also pull the block on its face back when it retracts, unlike the regular piston, which leaves the pushed block in place.

title: Weather
summary: Weather in Minecraft consists of occasional precipitation and storms that are temporary but global.

title: Locked chest
summary: The Locked chest or Steve Co. Supply Crate was a block intended to direct players to the Minecraft Store, a site created as an April Fools' gag.

title: Cookie
summary: Cookies are food items that can be obtained in large quantities, but do not restore hunger or saturation significantly.

title: Statistics
summary: Statistics is a game feature that allows players to track certain tasks in the form of numerical data.

title: Hunger
summary: Hunger is a player-specific feature of Minecraft that regulates player's certain abilities (health regeneration and the ability to sprint) the value of which is managed by the player's activity.

title: Recipe
summary: Recipes are a way to gradually guide new players into Minecraft by assisting them with the usage of crafting, smelting, and other block and item transformations in-game.

title: Minecraft - Volume Alpha
summary: Minecraft - Volume Alpha is the first Minecraft soundtrack album by C418, first released on Bandcamp on March 4, 2011. It features all 14 of the tracks that have been in the game since Alpha, plus 10 bonus tracks, for a total of 24 tracks and a length of nearly an hour. The second soundtrack album, Minecraft - Volume Beta, was released on November 9, 2013.

title: Cat
summary: A cat is a passive mob found in villages and swamp huts. They can be tamed and used to repel creepers and phantoms.

title: Achievement
summary: An achievement, known as a trophy on PlayStation 4, is a way to gradually guide new players into Minecraft and give them challenges to complete. In Java Edition, a system of advancements accomplishes this instead.

title: Ender Dragon
summary: The ender dragon is a gigantic flying hostile boss mob found when first entering the End. She is the largest naturally spawning mob in the game. She guards access to the end gateways that provide entry to the outer end islands in addition to the exit portal that allows return to the Overworld as well as access to the end credits of Minecraft. Her attacks involve charging at the player and her one-of-a-kind dragon acid attacks.

title: Wolf
summary: A wolf is a neutral mob that can be tamed and used to assist in combat with most hostile mobs.

title: Crying Obsidian
summary: Crying obsidian is a luminous variant of obsidian that can be used to craft a respawn anchor.

title: Redstone Repeater
summary: A redstone repeater is a block used in redstone circuits to "repeat" redstone signals back to full strength, delay signals, prevent signals moving backwards, or to "lock" signals in one state.

title: Bed
summary: A bed is a block that allows a player to sleep and to reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.

title: Seed (level generation)
summary: Seeds are values made up of character(s) (including negative or positive integers) that are used as the basis for generating every Minecraft world.

title: Entity
summary: Entities encompass all dynamic, moving objects throughout the Minecraft world.

title: Screenshot
summary: Screenshots are images taken in-game by pressing the (by default) F2 key  or Fn + F2 for Macs and some other keyboards.

title: Diamond
summary: A diamond is a rare mineral obtained from diamond ore or loot chests. They are mainly used to craft high-tier tools and armor, enchanting tables, blocks of diamond, and jukeboxes.

title: Minecraft.net
summary: Minecraft.net is the official website for the Minecraft franchise.

title: Breaking
summary: Breaking, digging, punching, or mining is a common activity in Minecraft, performed (by default) by holding the left mouse button or right trigger while the cursor is pointing at a block, or by long-pressing on the block on touch screens. Breaking is used to create passages, tunnels and clear away unwanted blocks, and is the primary way of acquiring blocks for future placement or crafting.

title: Light Blue Dye
summary: Light blue dye is a quasi-primary dye.

title: Gray Dye
summary: Gray dye is a secondary color dye.

title: Light Gray Dye
summary: Light gray dye is a quasi-primary dye.

title: Magenta Dye
summary: Magenta dye is a quasi-primary color dye.

title: Cyan Dye
summary: Cyan dye is a secondary dye color.

title: Cocoa Beans
summary:
Cocoa beans are a food ingredient obtained from cocoa pods that are used to plant them, and also to craft cookies and brown dye. 
Cocoa pods are plants used to grow cocoa beans.

title: Purple Dye
summary: Purple dye is a secondary dye color created by combining red dye and blue dye in a crafting grid.

title: Lime Dye
summary: Lime dye is a quasi-primary dye obtained by combining one green dye and one white dye in a crafting square, or by smelting a sea pickle.

title: Green Dye
summary: Green dye is a primary color dye.

title: Pink Dye
summary: Pink dye is a quasi-primary color dye.

title: Orange Dye
summary: Orange dye is a quasi-primary dye crafted from orange tulips, or by combining one red dye with one yellow dye.

title: Block of Lapis Lazuli
summary: A block of lapis lazuli is a storage block equivalent to nine pieces of lapis lazuli.

title: Charcoal
summary: Charcoal is an item obtained by smelting logs or wood. It is used as fuel, or for crafting torches and campfires. Unlike coal, charcoal cannot be traded with villagers or crafted into a block of coal. Coal and charcoal also cannot stack together. It can be used as a substitute for coal, as both charcoal and coal have an equivalent duration when smelted.

title: Lapis Lazuli
summary: Lapis lazuli is a mineral used for enchanting and decoration.

title: Sandstone
summary:
Sandstone is a solid block commonly found in deserts and beaches underneath sand.
Red sandstone is a related block, associated with red sand.

title: Lapis Lazuli Ore
summary:
Lapis lazuli ore is the ore block from which lapis lazuli is obtained.
Deepslate lapis lazuli ore is a variant of lapis lazuli ore that can generate in deepslate and tuff blobs.

title: Yellow Dye
summary: Yellow dye is a primary dye created by placing a dandelion or sunflower into a crafting grid.

title: Red Dye
summary: Red dye is a primary color dye created primarily from flowers.

title: Bone Meal
summary: Bone meal is a material that can be used as a fertilizer for most plants, as well as a crafting ingredient for dyes.

title: Birch
summary: A birch is a tree that appears similar to a common oak in terms of height and leaves, but with light bark and pale wood. It is most commonly found in birch forest biomes. Tall birches are found only in old growth birch forest biomes and cannot be grown with saplings without the use of cheats. As with oaks, a birch tree near flowers can generate with a bee nest attached.

title: Dye
summary: Dyes are a set of sixteen items used to change the color of wool, terracotta, certain mobs, the patterns on banners, shulker boxes, glass, concrete powder, candles, beds, firework stars, and text on signs and hanging signs‌.

title: Ink Sac
summary: An ink sac is an item dropped by a squid upon death used to create black dye, dark prismarine‌, and books and quills.

title: Bone
summary: A bone is an item primarily obtained from skeletons and similar mobs. It can be crafted into bone meal or used to tame wild wolves.

title: Squid
summary: A squid is a common passive aquatic mob that spawns in rivers and oceans.

title: Sugar
summary: Sugar is a food ingredient and brewing ingredient made from sugar canes.

title: Note Block
summary: A note block is a block that emits sounds when attacked, used or powered with redstone. The sound produced can be altered in various ways by using it or putting certain blocks directly above or below it. A note block's sound played repeatedly can be used to direct allays to stay nearby and drop collected items near it.

title: TNT
summary: TNT is a block that can be primed by a redstone signal, flint and steel, stray fire or flaming projectile to generate an explosion.

title: Redstone Lamp
summary: A redstone lamp is a block that produces light when activated with a redstone signal.

title: Water Bucket
summary: A water bucket is a bucket filled with water.

title: Lava
summary: Lava is a light-emitting fluid that causes fire damage, mostly found in the lower reaches of the Overworld and the Nether.

title: Explosion
summary: An explosion is a physical event, generally destructive, that can be caused by several different circumstances.

title: Cape
summary: Capes are commemorative items that can be worn in addition to the player's skin.

title: Cooked Cod
summary: Cooked cod is a food item obtained by cooking raw cod.

title: Fish
summary: Fish are aquatic creatures that are found in river and ocean biomes.

title: Lava Bucket
summary: A lava bucket is a bucket filled with lava.

title: Coal
summary: Coal is a mineral item mainly obtained from coal ore. It is primarily used for crafting torches and campfires, as well as fuel.

title: Gunpowder
summary: Gunpowder is an item that is used for explosion-related recipes, and as an ingredient in potions.

title: Farmland
summary: Farmland is a block on which seeds, root vegetables, and most saplings can be planted and grown.

title: Rain
summary: Rain is a type of weather that occurs occasionally in Minecraft.

title: Biome
summary: A biome is a region in a world with distinct geographical features, flora, temperatures, humidity ratings, and sky, water, grass and foliage colors. Biomes separate every generated world into different environments, such as forests, deserts and taigas.

title: Wool
summary: Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.

title: Controls
summary: Java and Bedrock editions for Windows uses the standard control scheme of mouse and keyboard controls as input. The game cannot be played using only a mouse or only a keyboard using the default control scheme. The controls menu is located in the Options setting.

title: Minecraft Wiki
summary: The official Minecraft wiki page, hosted by Fandom.

title: Spider Jockey
summary: Spider jockeys are the rare appearance of a spider or cave spider‌ being ridden by a skeleton, stray,‌ or wither skeleton.‌

title: Lantern
summary:
Lanterns are blocks that emit light.
Soul lanterns are turquoise variants crafted from soul torches.

title: Cloud
summary: Clouds are graphical effects in the sky. They serve a solely aesthetic purpose, although they can be used to determine compass directions because they always move westward.

title: Coral Block
summary: A coral block is a solid block that comes in five variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.

title: Iron Ingot
summary: Iron ingots are versatile metal ingots used extensively in crafting.

title: Piglin
summary: A piglin is a neutral mob found in the Nether. They become hostile unless the player is equipped with at least one piece of golden armor. Players can use gold ingots to barter with them for various items.

title: Glowstone Dust
summary: Glowstone dust is an item obtained from mining glowstone, and is mainly used to create potions with increased strength and decreased duration.

title: Desert
summary: The desert is an uncommon and expansive warm biome mainly consisting of sand.

title: Potion
summary: Potions are bottled substances designed to inflict effects. They are created by brewing and when drunk give the player an effect for a limited time. All potions are brewed from a water bottle, which is considered a type of potion but has no effects.

title: Fishing
summary: Fishing is the use of a fishing rod to obtain items, usually fish.

title: Pumpkin
summary: A pumpkin is a fruit block that appears in patches in grassy biomes.

title: Glowstone
summary: Glowstone is a light-emitting block that occurs in branching structures, found hanging from ceilings and overhangs in the Nether.

title: Jack o'Lantern
summary: A jack o'lantern is a solid block that provides light.

title: Raw Cod
summary: Raw cod is a food item that can be eaten by the player or cooked to make cooked cod.

title: Soul Sand
summary: Soul sand is a block found naturally only in the Nether and ancient cities. Soul sand usually slows down the movement of mobs and players walking on it. It is also used for growing nether wart, for crafting items that emit soul fire, and for constructing a wither.

title: Netherrack
summary: Netherrack is a frail stone block found abundantly in the Nether and in blobs below ruined portals. Fire lit on top of netherrack burns indefinitely.

title: Clock
summary: Clocks are time-telling devices that display the current in-game position of the sun and the moon. Clocks only function properly in the Overworld.

title: Nether portal
summary: A nether portal is a manufactured structure that acts as a gateway between the Overworld and the Nether dimensions.

title: Zombified Piglin
summary: A zombified piglin is a neutral undead variant of the piglin that inhabits the Nether. Zombified piglins normally ignore players, but if one is attacked, it and all zombified piglins in the vicinity become enraged and attack the aggressor with their golden swords.

title: Ghast
summary: Ghasts are large white floating ghost-like hostile mobs that live in the Nether and shoot explosive fireballs at the player.

title: Smooth Stone
summary: Smooth stone is a variant of stone made by smelting regular stone.

title: Ambience
summary: Ambience (also called ambience sounds or ambient sounds) are sounds that can be heard in specific conditions.

title: Durability
summary: Durability is a property that affects all tools, weapons, and armor, as well as certain other usable items. It represents the number of useful actions an item can perform and depletes upon item use. The bar starts at green, but as the durability decreases, the color gradually turns to yellow, then orange, and finally red. When the durability is empty, the item is about to become destroyed. Durability may be increased by merging two damaged items or repairing them with materials in an anvil or a grindstone, or through the Mending enchantment.

title: The Nether
summary: The Nether is a dangerous hell-like dimension containing fire, lava, fungal vegetation, many hostile mobs, and exclusive structures and biomes.

title: Animal
summary: The term Animal refers to a category of mobs and blocks that are mainly based on real life animals and mythical animals.

title: World
summary: A world or level is an individual Minecraft "universe" which encompasses an instance each of the Overworld, the Nether and the End. Worlds can be accessed through the world selection screen from the main menu and can be created with the "Create New World" button.

title: Spawn
summary: Spawning refers to the creation and placement of players and mobs in the Minecraft world.

title: Ore
summary: An ore is any uncommon rock-type block used to obtain specific resources.

title: Splash
summary: Splash texts are the yellow lines of text on the title screen.

title: Mojang Studios
summary: Mojang Studios is a first-party game developer for Xbox Game Studios. It is primarily known for the creation and development of Minecraft. Located in multiple locations around the world, Mojang Studios has 713 employees.

title: Slimeball
summary: A slimeball is a crafting ingredient commonly dropped by slimes, and can be sneezed out by pandas.

title: Feather
summary: Feathers are items dropped by chickens and parrots, as well as tamed cats as morning gifts.

title: Fishing Rod
summary: A fishing rod is a tool that casts a bobber used to fish in water or to hook and pull mobs, items and some entities towards the user.

title: Sneaking
summary: Sneaking (or crouching) is a gameplay feature that prevents players from falling off of blocks and helps them hide from mobs, among other useful features.

title: Mods
summary: Mods (short for modifications) change Minecraft​'s game content in some way, such as to make minor adjustments to the game's mechanics or implement entirely new features.

title: Tutorials
summary: The list below contains tutorials describing various factors of Minecraft.

title: Void
summary: The void is the name given to the empty space external to the world in any dimension, most commonly below it. In vanilla Minecraft, it can be entered by using a command or Map Editor, in Creative, using glitches, or by reaching the End.

title: Compass
summary: A compass is an item used to point to the world spawn or to a lodestone.

title: Flint
summary: Flint is a mineral obtained from gravel.

title: Difficulty
summary: Difficulty is an option in Minecraft that has a direct impact on the ease of gameplay, allowing the game's challenges to be tailored to the player's skill level.

title: Coral Fan
summary:
Coral fans are non-solid blocks that come in 5 variants: tube, brain, bubble, fire, and horn.
Dead coral fans are the dead variants of coral fans.

title: Fence
summary: A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.

title: Crafting
summary: Crafting is the process of constructing tools, items, and blocks in Minecraft. Players can craft by moving items from their inventory to a crafting grid, arranging them according to a recipe. A 2×2 crafting grid can be accessed from the player's inventory and a 3×3 grid can be accessed by using a crafting table. Items crafted in the 2×2 grid can also be crafted in the crafting table.

title: Mushroom
summary: A mushroom is a variety of fungus that grows and spreads in dark areas. Mushrooms generate as red or brown in color, and small or huge in size.

title: Health
summary: The health gauge and monitor in Minecraft displays how much damage the player is able to take before dying. It is usually based on a single row of 10 heart icons. Each full heart contains two halves, one health point each (the player has normally 20 maximum health points).

title: Daylight cycle
summary: The daylight cycle is a 20-minute-long cycle between two main light settings.

title: Slime
summary: Slimes are bouncy, cube-shaped hostile mobs that spawn deep underground in particular chunks, or at night in swamp biomes. They attack by jumping at their targets, come in three sizes and larger slimes can split into smaller ones on death.

title: Egg
summary: An egg is an item that can be used to craft food items, or thrown for a chance to spawn chicks on impact.

title: Music Disc
summary: Music discs are 15 unique items that can be played in jukeboxes.

title: Chicken
summary: A chicken is a passive mob found in grass biomes and the main source of chicken, feathers and eggs.

title: Minecart with Furnace
summary: A minecart with furnace is a furnace inside a minecart. It can be powered with coal or charcoal to propel it across a rail line for a limited time, which can be used to move other minecarts.

title: Minecart with Chest
summary: A minecart with chest is a single chest inside a minecart, and functions as such.

title: Jukebox
summary: A jukebox is a block used to play music discs.

title: Leather
summary: Leather is an item used to make item frames, armor and books.

title: Bamboo
summary: Bamboo is a plant found in jungles, and can be used as fuel for smelting or cooking, to breed pandas, crafting scaffolding, sticks, and block of bamboo.

title: Sword
summary: The sword is a melee weapon that is mainly used to deal damage to entities or for breaking certain blocks faster than by hand. A sword is made from one of six materials, in order of increasing quality and expense: wood, gold, stone, iron, diamond and netherite.

title: Paper
summary: Paper is an item crafted from sugar cane.

title: Brick
summary: Brick is an item used to craft the bricks block and flower pots.

title: Clay
summary: Clay is a block that can be found abundantly in lush caves, in patches in shallow surface water or converted from mud using pointed dripstone. It can be smelted into terracotta or broken into clay balls which are smeltable into bricks.

title: Sugar Cane
summary: Sugar cane is a block found as 1–4-block-tall plants near water in the Overworld. As an item, it is an important crafting ingredient.

title: Clay Ball
summary: A clay ball is the item obtained from clay used for crafting or making bricks.

title: Book
summary: Books are items used in enchanting and crafting.

title: Milk Bucket
summary: A milk bucket is a drink and ingredient obtained from cows, mooshrooms, and goats.

title: Cow
summary: A cow is a passive mob found in most grassy biomes and a source of leather, beef and milk.

title: Cactus
summary: A cactus is a plant block that generates naturally in dry areas and causes damage.

title: Snow Block
summary: A snow block is a full-sized block of snow.

title: Snowball
summary: Snowballs are throwable combat items that hit but do not damage most mobs on impact.

title: Golden Apple
summary: A golden apple is a food item that bestows beneficial effects when consumed, and is also used to cure a zombie villager under the Weakness effect into a normal villager.

title: Ice
summary: Ice is a translucent solid block. It can slide entities using all methods of transportation (excluding minecarts).

title: Snow
summary: Snow is a ground cover block that is commonly caused by snowfall.

title: Fence Gate
summary: A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

title: Redstone Dust
summary: Redstone dust is a mineral that can transmit redstone power when placed as a block.

title: Inventory
summary: The inventory is the pop-up menu that the player uses to manage items they carry. From this screen a player can equip armor, craft items on a 2×2 grid, and equip tools, blocks, and items. The player's skin is also displayed here.

title: Redstone Ore
summary:
Redstone ore is the ore block from which redstone is obtained.
Deepslate redstone ore is a variant of redstone ore that can generate in deepslate and tuff blobs.

title: Chunk
summary: A chunk is a 384-block tall 16×16 segment of a world. Chunks are the method used by the  world generator to divide maps into manageable pieces.

title: Door
summary: A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.

title: Redstone Torch
summary: A redstone torch is a non-solid block that can be used as a toggleable redstone power source, as well as a signal inverter.

title: Button
summary: A button is a non-solid block that can provide temporary redstone power.

title: Pressure Plate
summary: A pressure plate is a non-solid block that can be used to detect players, mobs, items, etc.

title: Lever
summary: A lever is a non-solid block that can provide switchable redstone power.

title: Slab
summary: Slabs are half-height versions of their respective blocks.

title: Mossy Cobblestone
summary: Mossy cobblestone is a variant of cobblestone with moss on it. It is mainly used for crafting or as building block.

title: Planks
summary: Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes. They are one of the first things that a player can craft in Survival and Adventure modes. Three categories of planks can be differentiated: Overworld planks made from tree logs, bamboo planks made from blocks of bamboo,‌ and nonflammable Nether planks made from huge fungus stems.

title: Fire
summary: Fire is a non-solid block that can spread to nearby flammable blocks and destroy them.

title: Sign
summary: A sign is a non-solid block that can display text.

title: Flower
summary: Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.

title: Monster Spawner
summary: A monster spawner is a cage-like block that can spawn mobs, the type of which being visible within it as a miniature spinning version. It cannot be obtained as an item or moved by a piston, and drops experience orbs when broken.

title: Pig
summary: A pig is a common passive mob found in most grass biomes. Pigs are a source of porkchops and can be equipped with a saddle to be driven.

title: Saddle
summary: A saddle is an item required to ride pigs and striders or control ridden camels‌, horses, donkeys and mules.

title: Iron Bars
summary: Iron bars are blocks that serve a similar purpose to glass panes, but made of iron instead of glass.

title: Survival
summary: Survival is one of the game modes in Minecraft.

title: Damage
summary: Damage represents injury from attacks or natural causes.

title: Chestplate
summary: Chestplates are a type of armor that covers the upper body of the player. There are six types of chestplates: leather, chainmail, iron, diamond, gold and netherite.

title: Item
summary: An item is an object that exists only within the player's inventory and hands, or displayed in item frames or armor stands.

title: Spider
summary: Spiders are common neutral mobs that attack players on sight in dark areas. They can climb walls and attack by jumping and biting.

title: Bucket
summary: A bucket is an item used to carry water, lava, milk, powder snow, and various aquatic mobs.

title: Rail
summary: Rails are non-solid blocks that provide a path along which minecarts can travel.

title: Minecart
summary: A minecart is a train-like vehicle entity that runs on rails.

title: Food
summary: Food refers to any consumable items that, when eaten, restore hunger points and hunger saturation points, and sometimes cause status effects.

title: Arrow
summary: An arrow serves as ammunition for bows, crossbows, and dispensers. Arrows can be modified to imbue status effects on players and mobs.

title: Leggings
summary: Leggings are a type of armor that covers the lower body of the player. There are six types of leggings: leather pants, chainmail leggings, iron leggings, diamond leggings, gold leggings, and netherite leggings.

title: Boots
summary: Boots are a type of armor that covers the feet of the player. There are six types of boots: leather boots, chainmail boots, iron boots, diamond boots, gold boots, and netherite boots.

title: Helmet
summary: Helmets are a type of armor that covers the head of the player. There are seven types of helmets: leather cap, chainmail helmet, iron helmet, diamond helmet, gold helmet, netherite helmet, and turtle shell.

title: Stick
summary: A stick is an item used for crafting many tools and items.

title: Bowl
summary: Bowls are containers that can hold certain foods.

title: Axe
summary: An axe is a tool mainly used to hasten the breaking of wood-based blocks, remove the surface layer of certain blocks, and as a melee weapon.

title: Shovel
summary: Shovels are tools used to ease the process of collecting dirt, sand and other blocks with silk touch mining the complete block.

title: Ladder
summary: Ladders are solid blocks used for climbing walls either vertically or horizontally. They can be placed only on the sides of other blocks.

title: Pickaxe
summary: A pickaxe is one of the most commonly used tools in the game, being required to mine all ores, rock, rock-based blocks and metal-based blocks. A pickaxe allows the player to mine blocks at faster speeds, depending on the material it is made from. Specific pickaxe materials are also required to harvest certain types of blocks.

title: Hoe
summary: A hoe is a tool used to till dirt, grass blocks, and dirt paths into farmland, convert coarse dirt into dirt, as well as to harvest certain plant-based blocks quickly.

title: Wood
summary:
Wood or hyphae is a block that has the log's "bark" texture on all six sides. It comes in 9 types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, crimson, and warped. 
Stripped wood or stripped hyphae is a variant obtained when any axe is used on wood or hyphae respectively.

title: Wheat
summary: Wheat is an item primarily obtained by harvesting fully-grown wheat crops. It is used for crafting as well as to feed certain animals.

title: Mushroom Stew
summary: Mushroom stew is a food item.

title: Cooked Porkchop
summary: Cooked porkchop is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Bread
summary: Bread is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Crafting Table
summary: A crafting table is a utility block that gives access to all crafting recipes, including many not available from the inventory's crafting grid.

title: Raw Porkchop
summary: A raw porkchop is a food item that can be eaten by the player or cooked to make a cooked porkchop.

title: Coal Ore
summary:
Coal ore is a mineral block that drops coal when mined.
Deepslate coal ore is a variant of coal ore that rarely generates at the top of the deepslate layer.

title: Diamond Ore
summary:
Diamond ore is a rare ore that generates deep underground, and is the only reliable source of diamonds.
Deepslate diamond ore is a variant of diamond ore that can generate in deepslate and tuff blobs.

title: Sapling
summary: A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.

title: Flint and Steel
summary: Flint and steel is a tool used to create fire or to ignite certain blocks, structures and mobs.

title: Smelting
summary: Smelting is a method of obtaining refined goods from raw materials by heating in a furnace, blast furnace, smoker or campfire. For example, raw iron can be smelted to produce iron ingots using coal as fuel. Like crafting, smelting uses recipes to determine what item is produced, but its recipes are simpler. Smelting also yields experience.

title: Painting
summary: Paintings are decorative entities that hang on walls.

title: Mob
summary: A mob is an AI-driven game entity resembling a living creature. The term "mob" is short for "mobile entity". All mobs can be attacked and hurt (from falling, attacked by a player or another mob, falling into the void, hit by an arrow, etc), and have some form of voluntary movement. Different types of mobs often have unique AI and loot.

title: Moon
summary: The moon is a celestial body that appears in the night sky.

title: Block of Diamond
summary: A block of diamond is a precious mineral block equivalent to nine diamonds.

title: Chest
summary: A chest is a block that stores items.

title: Light
summary: Light (or lighting) in Minecraft affects visibility, mob spawning, and plant growth. There are three aspects of Minecraft's lighting system: light level, internal light level, and rendered brightness.

title: Torch
summary:
Torches are non-solid blocks that emit light.
Soul torches are turquoise variants crafted with the addition of soul soil or soul sand.

title: Dungeon
summary: A dungeon, also referred to as a monster room in its ID, is a structure-like feature that appears in the Overworld that contains a monster spawner that produces either zombies, skeletons, or spiders.

title: Iron Ore
summary:
Iron ore is a mineral block found underground. It is a source of raw iron, which can be smelted into iron ingots. 
Deepslate iron ore is a variant of iron ore that can generate in deepslate and tuff blobs.

title: Sheep
summary: Sheep are common passive mobs that supply wool and mutton and are found in many of the grassy biomes.

title: Bricks
summary: Bricks are a decorative building block.

title: Bookshelf
summary: Bookshelves are blocks that enhance enchanting with an enchanting table.

title: Obsidian
summary: Obsidian is a block found in all dimensions or created when water flows over a lava source. It has high hardness and blast resistance, rendering it immune to normal explosions. Obsidian is used for crafting and to make the frame for a nether portal. It can only be obtained by mining it with a Diamond or Netherite Pickaxe.

title: Block of Iron
summary: A block of iron is a precious metal block equivalent to nine iron ingots.

title: Stairs
summary: Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.

title: Armor
summary: Armor is a category of items that provide players and certain mobs with varying levels of protection from common damage types, and appear graphically on the wearer. These items include several different tiers of helmets, chestplates, leggings, and boots, which can each be placed in designated armor slots of a player's inventory for use.

title: Adventure
summary: Adventure mode is a game mode intended for player-created maps, limiting some of the gameplay in Minecraft. In this mode, the player cannot directly destroy any blocks with any tools or place any blocks, in order to avoid spoiling adventure maps or griefing servers. Adventure mode is accessible only with commands or the game mode selector.

title: Bow
summary: A bow is a ranged weapon that shoots arrows.

title: Skeleton
summary: A skeleton is a common undead hostile mob equipped with a bow. They attack by firing arrows at their target with their bow.

title: Creeper
summary: A creeper is a common hostile mob that silently approaches players and explodes, which can destroy blocks and kill unarmored players on any difficulty.

title: Zombie
summary: Zombies are common undead hostile mobs that deal melee damage and attack in groups.

title: Overworld
summary: The Overworld is the dimension in which all players begin their Minecraft world. Most players spend their time in this dimension.

title: Debug screen
summary: The debug screen is triggered when the F3 key is pressed. It shows the chunk cache, the memory usage, various parameters, the player's map coordinates and a graph that measures the game's current frame rate.

title: Bedrock
summary: Bedrock is a block that is normally indestructible in Survival.

title: Solid block
summary: Solid blocks consist of any type of block that has a collision block that players, mobs, or other entities cannot move through.

title: Air
summary:
Air is an invisible block used to define empty space where any other blocks could otherwise exist.
Cave air‌ is the underground air found in caves and some generated structures.
Void air‌ is used internally for blocks above (Y>319) and below (Y<-64) the world, and in unloaded chunks.

title: Tree
summary: A tree is a common plant feature that mainly consists of logs and leaves.

title: Cave
summary: A cave (also known as a cavern) is a common terrain feature that generates in the Overworld and the Nether. Caves are usually found underground. They are open spaces of various sizes and shapes that often intersect with each another or with different generated structures, creating vast cave systems. They feature an abundance of ores, as well as hostile mobs that spawn in the darkness.

title: Sun
summary: The sun is a celestial body that provides light for the Overworld.

title: Spleef
summary: Spleef is a competitive minigame played within Minecraft.

title: Gold Ingot
summary: A gold ingot is a metal ingot used to craft various items, and also used as currency for bartering with piglins.

title: Commands
summary: Commands, also known as console commands and slash commands, are advanced features activated by typing certain strings of text.

title: Server
summary: Minecraft servers allow players to play online or via a local area network with other people. Internally, the game runs a server for single-player games, this was done in order to make the single-player game experience consistent with the multiplayer experience and make it so that changes made to the game such as bug fixes apply to both single-player games and multiplayer games.  Official server software is only available on Java Edition in the release state. The Bedrock Edition server software is currently in Alpha.

title: Block of Gold
summary: A block of gold is a precious metal block equivalent to nine gold ingots.

title: Shrub
summary: Shrubs (known as Ferns, in Bedrock Edition) are variants of grass that do not generate naturally‌ and are currently only obtainable in Legacy Console Edition via the creative inventory and in Bedrock Edition via commands. They have the same characteristics as grass and ferns.

title: Glass
summary: Glass is a decorative and fully transparent solid block that can be dyed into stained glass, or crafted into tinted glass.

title: Sponge
summary: A sponge is a block that can be used to remove water around itself when placed, turning into a wet sponge in the process.

title: Skin
summary: Skins refer to the textures that are placed onto a player or mob model.

title: Block
summary: Blocks are the basic units of structure in Minecraft that make up the game's world. Many blocks can be collected and placed anywhere in the game's world, as well as be used as helpful resources.

title: Creative
summary: Creative mode is one of the main game modes in Minecraft. Creative mode strips away the survival aspects of Minecraft and allows players to easily create and destroy structures and mechanisms with the inclusion of an infinite use of blocks and flying. It also changes some of the background music.

title: Fluid
summary: Fluids are blocks that are able to flow over the terrain, forming rivers or falls.

title: Markus Persson
summary: Markus Alexej Persson, more commonly known under the alias Notch, is the creator of Minecraft and one of the founders of Mojang Studios.

title: Gameplay
summary: Gameplay in most game modes of Minecraft consists mainly of adding and destroying a variety of different blocks in a randomly generated world.

title: Gold Ore
summary:
Gold ore is a rare mineral block found underground.
Deepslate gold ore is a variant of gold ore that can generate in deepslate and tuff.

title: Grass Block
summary: A grass block is a natural block that generates abundantly across the surface of the Overworld.

title: Gravel
summary: Gravel is a gravity-affected block found in the Overworld and the Nether. It is a source of flint, which has a chance to drop when gravel is broken.

title: Leaves
summary: Leaves are natural blocks that generate as part of trees. Despite being a full block, they can be waterlogged.

title: Log
summary: A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block, and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient.

title: Dirt
summary: Dirt is a block found abundantly in most biomes under a layer of grass blocks at the top of the Overworld.

title: Stone
summary: Stone is a block found underground in the Overworld or on the surface of mountains.

title: Multiplayer
summary: Multiplayer is the server-based version of Minecraft that enables multiple players to interact with each other on a single world, allowing them to work together to mine ores, build structures, and fight mobs (or each other), or to simply play together.

title: Cobblestone
summary: Cobblestone is a common block, obtained from mining stone. It is mainly used for crafting or as a building block.
